Description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)
 
 The Consumer Pricing, Analytics & Reporting Team (CPAR) within OptumRx uses sophisticated algorithms and techniques to understand, quantify and inform our product lines of business, operations and leaders with practical insights for improving their services and operations in support of a world-class OptumRx Consumer Experience. The team uses a blend of scientific, problem solving, and quantitative skills to develop and deliver groundbreaking methods addressing critical problems in our digital environment. The CPAR team collaborates across product, design, engineer, and IT teams through data science, machine learning, and AI.
 
 Do you want to be part of a growing data science and data engineering team that is helping to shape the digital experiences for millions of customers? As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work cross-functionally with other data scientists, analysts, business leaders, and product managers to design, develop, and deploy state-of-the-art models, insights & tools that make a meaningful difference to millions of our customers. You will glean actionable insights from Optum’s vast trove of data to translate business problems into predictive models.
 
 This is a unique, high visibility opportunity for someone who wants to have a business impact, dive deep into large-scale data analyses machine learning, reinforcement learning, enable measurable actions and work closely with product and operations teams. This position will report directly to the CPAR Director.
Responsibilities:
Lead and deliver data science solutions leveraging the latest machine learning techniques, including exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and selection, model selection, evaluation, and cross-validation, a deployment that operationalizes at scale and that drives value to OptumRx
 Research and apply a range of data science methodologies and machine learning models to complex business problems
 Develop, implement, and maintain tools and algorithms using Python and/or other languages with appropriate libraries and frameworks
 Communicate results as well as their uncertainty and limitations effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or related discipline
 3+ years of relevant real-world experience researching, developing, and delivering high impact data-driven insights through machine learning
 3+ years of experience using exploratory data analysis, data profiling, and feature engineering on large structured and unstructured datasets
 Hands-on, demonstrable computer programming skill in SQL, Python, R, or similar programming language
 Solid communication skills - ability to succinctly communicate results and tell compelling stories with data to any audience (e.g. presenting findings and deep dives to senior leadership)
Preferred Qualifications:
Preferred Qualifications
 Master’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or related discipline
 Deep knowledge of probability, statistics, and machine learning algorithms with the ability to determine when to apply them
 Deep understanding of supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques
 Knowledge of Azure, or similar cloud platforms
 Experience presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences and history of publications or presentations at conferences

Job Title: Senior Principal Data Scientist - Telecommute in CST or EST Time zone
Description:
UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

The UHC Advanced Research and Analytics (ARA) organization provides data-driven insights and builds advanced AI / ML solutions to the various lines of business and shared services organizations within UnitedHealthcare. The ARA team partners with various entities within the enterprise to increase operational value, optimize experience and lower healthcare costs.

The ARA team serves across a wide variety of business domains including claims processing, payment integrity (fraud, waste, abuse, error), consumer experience (omnichannel, customer service, campaigns, net promoter scores), provider service models, and many more.

This Senior Principal Data Scientist role will work within the Transactions Analytics and Automation Domain to develop transformative solutions that lead to more effective decision-making and more efficient execution across multiple lines of business. This role specifically focuses on supporting Claim Operations teams throughout UnitedHealthcare in their efforts to streamline processes and reduce waste due to rework and appeals.

If you are located or willing to work within Eastern Time zone OR Central Time zone hours, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Work with vast amounts of data from multiple sources to deliver high-impact actionable insights to senior leadership and business operations; enable data-driven decision-making across the enterprise to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of UHC Operations
Perform exploratory data analysis from structured, unstructured, and diverse datasets; apply knowledge of statistics, machine learning, programming, data modeling, simulation, and advanced mathematics to recognize patterns, identify opportunities, pose business questions, and make valuable discoveries leading to prototype development and product improvement
Make presentations to Sr. executives and decision-makers
Serve as a thought leader for the Transactions Analytics domain. Provide expert advisory services for Benefit Operations strategy, metrics, product development, and analytics vision to senior leadership
Partner with various functions to produce innovative and transformative data science solutions which directly contribute to achieving enterprise goals and vision
Build relationships and drive awareness and knowledge of advanced analytics while promoting the capability areas of Advanced Research & Analytics team
Serve as a subject matter expert in data science dealing specifically with medical claim data utilized and created
Basic Qualifications:
10+ years of experience working on data science initiatives in a corporate environment
5+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis, data-driven investigations, data storytelling, visualizations, and analytic insight creation for executive consumption
Experience handling terabyte size datasets, diving into data to discover hidden patterns, using data visualization tools
Experience with R and/or Python
Advanced proficiency in SQL
Advanced proficiency in Excel
Sound business focus; must excel at connecting business requirements to analytic objectives and to measurable business benefit
Experience with extracting data from Enterprise Data Warehouses and Enterprise Data Lakes
Knowledge and experience analyzing Medical claim data, as well as standard processes that generate data through the health care claim adjudication process.
Work within EST and/or CST hours
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree or higher in a highly quantitative field
Experience with Spark
Experience with cloud based analytic services
Experience with any of the following: machine learning platforms, data mart development and engineering, advanced statistics, natural language processing, optical character recognition and process mining
Highly experienced in data visualization tools such as Tableau; PowerBI

Description:
"Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

What if predicting infectious disease spread was as common and accepted as weather forecasting? What if we can predict who will develop diseases and conditions before they occur? How can we apply data science to equalize healthcare for everyone?

These are the types of questions that we continually ask ourselves. Our aim is to apply data science to really tough problems in order to save lives. Our world class team of scientists, clinicians, statisticians, engineers with partners in academia and industry are leaning into these and other challenges. We are looking for data scientists to join us on our journey. Do you want to work on things that have direct, tangible impact on peoples’ health? We invite you to join our team and find out how meaningful work can be."
Responsibilities:
Use appropriate data sampling, data preparation, analytic and statistical methodology to develop predictive models
Participate in the development of innovative machine learning solutions to solve complex problems
Source, clean and perform exploratory data analysis to verify data integrity and provide input to assist with model development
Provide testing, deployment, and maintenance of existing models
Support business needs around analytics, predictive modeling, and business intelligence
Perform ad-hoc analyses as required
Communicate findings, verbally and visually, to business partners and clients
Basic Qualifications: 2+ years of hands-on professional experience in advanced analytics
Preferred Qualifications:
BS in science, applied mathematics, (bio) statistics, applied statistics, economics, or similar quantitative fields of study
Data mining / data analysis methods, building and implementing statistical and predictive models
Model validation, testing and tuning
Languages such as Python or R
Ml frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Kera
Big data frameworks such as Hadoop and Hive
Relational databases

The PacWest Health Plan and Institutional Contract Analytics team within Optum Care is expanding. We are looking for experienced Data Scientists to join this growing team. Senior Data Scientist develops innovative and effective approaches to solve our analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies. Sr. Data Scientist also provides directions and guidelines to Data Scientists to discover business insights, identifies opportunities, and provides solutions and recommendations to solve business problems through the use of statistical, algorithmic, data mining, and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, Sr. Data Scientist is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database, and computing environments, and communicating results.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Validates data integrity and consistency across data models, streams, and analytics
Develops consistent structures, processes, and formats toward a standardized data management structure
Develops complex reports utilizing analytical tools and expertise to meet organizational requirements
Leads projects and reports on status as requested
Collaborates with key stake holders in defining data models and analytics to support organizational objectives, operational initiatives, and monitoring
Identifies ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality
Lead discovery processes and partner with contract analytics leadership to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome
Create and provide sound statistical analyses and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions
Collaborates with the data steward to gather information to be used for analytics and predictive model building purpose and to ensure the data meets the qualification and assurance requirements of the analyses
Design sampling methodology, prepare data, including data cleaning, univariate analysis, missing value imputation, etc., identify appropriate analytic and statistical methodology, develop predictive models and document process and results
Communicate analytics results and predictive models to business partners
Provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of statistical models and recommend ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information
Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information
Basic Qualifications:
BS degree in computer science, applied mathematics, (bio) statistics, applied statistics, economics, or similar quantitative fields of study
5+ years of experience of hands-on modeling skills and strong analytic programming skills using R or Python
5+ years of experience manipulating large datasets and using databases
3+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis and predictive analytics with machine learning/statistical modeling techniques
3+ years of experience building dashboards using data tools
Experience in data preparation, data profiling, data auditing and data analytics
Experience working with analytical concepts and analytical solutions that can help customers; solutions around healthcare claims cost reduction preferred
Experience learning and working with new concepts and technologies - all the way down to the theorems - and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with health care claims data
Experience with Post Payment Integrity processes
Experience with SQL, Python, Hadoop (MapReduce, PIG, Hive, Spark), R, H2O, or equivalent
UI design experience for automated and-or end-user-interactive visualizations, displays or reports based on the models’ outcomes (for example using Tableau)
Experience with Version Control (for example Git Version Control system)
Working knowledge and understanding of medical coding, including ICD, CPT, DRG, etc.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Minnetonka, MN or Telecommute
Description:
This isn't packaged goods. It's a bigger challenge than that. Here you're making a difference in people's lives, starting with your own. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

The Senior Data Scientist will produce innovative solutions driven by exploratory data analysis from unstructured, diverse datasets typically measured in gigabytes or larger. Applies knowledge of statistics, machine learning, programming, data modeling, simulation, and advanced mathematics to recognize patterns, identify opportunities, pose business questions, and make valuable discoveries leading to prototype development and product improvement. Uses a flexible, analytical approach to design, develop, and evaluate predictive and prescriptive models and advanced algorithms that lead to optimal value extraction from the data. Works with analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Hadoop and others to perform analysis and interpret data. This function is not intended for employees performing the following work: less complex analysis on small data sets; rules-based algorithmic or descriptive analytics; development of big data infrastructure.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges
Responsibilities:
Support Member Marketing
Perform marketing analytics & modeling work to support and drive insights for campaigns by leveraging ML / AI data science techniques
Understand the client's needs and articulating a solution to drive outcomes
Build relationships with clients to support campaign efforts
Comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams
Passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes
Basic Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Math, Statistics, Data Science
3+ years of experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, SAS, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets, work experience outside of graduate coursework is preferred.
Experience using a variety of data analysis methods/data mining, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing predictive models, using / creating algorithms and creating / running simulations
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages / drawbacks
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications
Deep understanding of data science and ability to deliver models, communicate results and juggle multiple priorities
Experience learning and mastering new technologies and techniques
Experience working independently and creatively solving problems where statistical modeling techniques can be applied
Proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights
Preferred Qualifications: Onsite in Minnetonka, MN

Description:
If you want to achieve more in your mission of health care, you have to be really smart about the business of health care. Challenge yourself, your peers and our industry by shaping what health care looks like and doing your life's best work.

We’re creating opportunities in every corner of the health care marketplace to improve lives while we’re building careers. And that means continuous career growth opportunities for you. While we support you with the latest tools, advanced training and the combined strength of high caliber co-workers, you can continue on following the path of your life’s best work.

The Sr. Data Scientist will support the data management and advanced analytics environment for a complex, multi-brand organization, and is responsible for applying machine learning and other advanced statistical techniques to provide data-driven solutions. This position is also responsible for the development and leadership of more junior level data science members. The role requires a technologically strong background with an aptitude for working with business stakeholders to manage and solve complex analytical problems that help drive business growth. Main projects will drive the Azure ML platform maturity in the sales and marketing domains to increase sales, lower the cost of acquisition, and improve the consumer experience.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Work with the data analytics and business teams to integrate and transform lead generation, direct-to-consumer, product, customer experience, recommendations & much more
Engage with business stakeholders to ask the right questions and begin the discovery process
Acquire and prepare data for various analytical and ML projects
Integrate with existing and future state platform and technology
Initial data investigation and exploratory data analysis
Take responsibility for estimating, planning, and managing work and reporting on progress
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of experience related to data, data management and/or data analytics
3+ years of SQL experience
2+ years of Python and/or R experience
2+ years of Azure experience
Ability to create various types of predictive models
ML Ops and/or DevOps experience
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex procedures to technical and non-technical colleagues
Demonstrated attention to detail and desire to probe further into data
Experience with Data Visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience with Unstructured Data
End-to-end understanding of how technologies are integrated
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in quantitative field
Machine Learning experience in a sales and/or marketing setting
SAFe experience

Job Title: Data Scientist, Office for Provider Advancement - Telecommute
Description:
The role of Data Scientist II, is a key role, responsible for the collection, analysis, presentation and publication of data, metrics and key performance indicators. In support of the quadruple aim and Optum Care’s mission, the Office for Provider Advancement (OPA) is seeking a Data Scientist that will work integrally with the pillar leads and other business units to deliver on key outcomes, driving patient and provider experience and experience.
Support collection, statistical analysis, presentation and publication of research studies
Help pull operational access standards from care delivery organization (CDO) sources for patient experience
Evaluate and analyze the data for manuscripts pertaining to burnout and teammate, provider and patient experience
Partner with Human Capital and UHG on provider survey analysis
Dependent upon interest, experience, and need, the Scientist may also have growth/development opportunities such as oversight of additional staff, quality monitoring or contributing to education and training. Reporting to the Senior National Medical Director, Chief of the OPA, this position sits in the Office for Provider Advancement (OPA) within Optum Care’s Clinical Performance. OPA focuses on making Optum Care the best place to work for the physicians and providers of the entire care team, ensuring they have what they need to deliver the best care possible to our patients. OPA’s work is determined through clinical governance and focuses on clinical outcomes research, physician/provider and patient experience, physician development and partnership, and an equitable, responsible culture. This position includes a variety of functions related to the general management and general business operations within the OPA.
Responsibilities:
"Under the direction of the Chief of the Office for Provider Advancement (OPA), contribute to all phases of an analytics/health outcomes research project, including formulation, research, development, implementation, testing, and maintenance
Work integrally with OPA pillar leads and other business units to delivery on key business goals, outcomes and milestones:
Support collection, statistical analyses, presentation and publication of research studies
Collaborate with health care analytics on pulling data sources and performing interim analyses on disparate projects fulfilling several clinical priorities
Evaluate and analyze the data for manuscripts pertaining to burnout and teammate, provider and patient experience
Partner with Human Capital and UnitedHealth Group on provider survey analyses
Use sophisticated computer software, such as databases and statistical packages, to analyze and solve problems. Use statistical software to simulate current and future events and evaluate alternative courses of action
Present findings to peers and data science/research leadership
Maintain an awareness of trends in the field and research and suggest new methodologies"
Basic Qualifications:
BS/BA and 3+ years of professional experience
Experience applying descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive statistics to real-world problems
Experience in general programming language, e.g., Python
Experience querying relational databases using SQL
Experience in statistical computing and graphics using RStudio
Preferred Qualifications:
MS with 2+ years of professional experience
Degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or related quantitative field
Experience with healthcare economics/science/product development
Understanding of one or more of the following:
Statistics: Generalized linear models, time series models, and forecasting techniques
Predictive Modeling: linear regression (ordinary least squares), logistic regression, ridge regression, time series, decision trees, neural networks, and episode treatment groups
Operations Research: Linear and mixed integer optimization and discrete event simulation
Machine Learning: Common supervised and unsupervised ML models, including decision trees, nearest neighbor models, and neural nets; and a standard ML library, e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow
Experience creating compelling data visualizations
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Solid problem-solving skills

Description:

The Commercial data Science team within Optum Insight (OI) Payer Analytics is expanding. We are looking for experienced Data Scientists to join this growing team. This individual will be responsible on the development and delivery of large and complex predictive modeling projects for healthcare Payment Integrity processes. Senior Data Scientist-Post Pay develops innovative and effective approaches to solve client's analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies. Sr. Data Scientist also provides directions and guidelines to Data Scientists to discover business insights, identifies opportunities, and provides solutions and recommendations to solve business problems through the use of statistical, algorithmic, data mining, and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, Sr. Data Scientist is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database, and computing environments, and communicating results.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to build, maintain, and improve on multiple predictive detection engines in Optum Insight payer analytics
Lead discovery processes with Data Scientists and partner with Payment Integrity Operation management to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome
Create and provide sound statistical analyses and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions
Collaborates with the data steward to gather information to be used for analytics and predictive model building purpose and to ensure the data meets the qualification and assurance requirements of the analyses
Design sampling methodology, prepare data, including data cleaning, univariate analysis, missing value imputation, etc., identify appropriate analytic and statistical methodology, develop predictive models and document process and results
Communicate analytics results and predictive models to business partners and clients
Provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of statistical models and recommend ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information
Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information
Basic Qualifications:
BS, Master's or Ph.D. degree in computer science, applied mathematics, (bio) statistics, applied statistics, economics, or similar quantitative fields of study
3+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis and predictive analytics with machine learning/statistical modeling techniques.
5+ years of experience of hands-on modeling skills and strong analytic programming skills using R or Python
5+ years of experience manipulating large datasets and using databases
Experience working with analytical concepts and analytical solutions that can help customers; solutions around healthcare claims cost reduction preferred
Experience learning and working with new concepts and technologies - all the way down to the theorems - and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues
Telecommute is available for this role
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with health care claims data
Experience with Post Payment Integrity processes
Experience with SQL, Python, Hadoop (MapReduce, PIG, Hive, Spark), R, H2O, or equivalent
UI design experience for automated and-or end-user-interactive visualizations, displays or reports based on the models’ outcomes (for example using Tableau)
Experience with Version Control (for example Git Version Control system)
Working knowledge and understanding of medical coding, including ICD, CPT, DRG, etc.

Description:
Energize your career with one of Healthcare’s fastest growing companies.

You dream of a great career with a great company – where you can make an impact and help people. We dream of giving you the opportunity to do just this. And with the incredible growth of our business, it is a dream that definitely can come true. Already one of the world’s leading Healthcare companies, UnitedHealth Group is restlessly pursuing new ways to operate our service centers, improve our service levels and help people lead healthier lives. We live for the opportunity to make a difference and right now, we are living it up.

This opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: Optum – a growing part of our family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a Fortune 5 leader.

Optum Analytics solutions create a longitudinal view of both individual patients and patient populations. We gather, normalize, and analyze data from disparate sources that, uniquely, span the continuum of care--including EHRs, Practice Management Systems and claims. Our EHR data alone accounts for over 80M patient lives across the U.S.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
We are looking for a data scientist who is eager to tackle the challenges of extracting insights from vast amounts of EHR data originating from multiple sources
You will work with a diverse set of Optum researchers, clinicians, internal and external clients to define the projects and see them through to completion that cover a range of clinical focus
You would be participating in the development of our end-to-end NLP pipeline, building descriptive and predictive analytics and producing research validations
Specifically, as a member of our collaborative team you will be working with structured and unstructured data to explore the data, develop models, and performing research analytics
You will have the opportunity to work with open-source distributed data processing frameworks, such as Apache Spark and build scalable machine learning applications and deploy them in production
The right candidate will have strong prioritization skills, ability to manage ad hoc requests in parallel with ongoing projects
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or Linguistics or equivalent degree area
3+ years of experience as a hands-on data scientist, non-managerial role and executing on data science, analytics, or programming projects (academic projects may be considered to equal the required 1+ year of experience. Projects need to be clearly outlined in the resume)
3+ years of experience in machine learning, predictive modeling, or natural language processing
3+ years of experience in Python
Experience with leveraging best practices conducting advanced analytics projects
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Spark NLP, Pandas, or spaCy
Experience with open-source distributed data processing frameworks, such as Spark
Experience presenting technical results to broad audiences with effective visualizations
Experience in Biostatistics or related field
Experience with SQL or relational databases
Familiarity with EHR data and standards

Our team is seeking a Principal Data Scientist with expertise and experience in machine learning. This individual will be responsible for the research and development of advanced, high-impact machine learning techniques for various healthcare use cases. This role provides an unprecedented opportunity to leverage large-scale proprietary healthcare datasets, internal team of subject matter experts and cutting-edge computing cloud infrastructure to craft innovative machine learning problems to challenging and high-impact healthcare problems.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Apply advanced machine learning and predictive modeling techniques to build, maintain, and improve on multiple predictive detection engines in Optum Enterprise Analytics
Develop actionable machine learning solutions and propose recommendations and strategies to solve commercial opportunities in unique ways that return optimal value to our business
Be a storyteller to explain the ‘why and how’ of your data driven recommendations to cross-functional teams
Assess internal data and processes to determine opportunities for application of advanced analytics for broad division-wide analytic usage
Develop and expand a fledgling applied research program with focus on impact-focused initiatives, rapid prototyping and obsession with converting applied research into software
Be a hands-on leader and teach by example by building prototypes using variety of predictive methods while adhering to the ML development cycle (e.g. iterative EDA, prediction specification, feature engineering and model tuning)
Participate in meetings business stakeholders, data experts, software/platform engineering, physicians to scope R&D use-cases and convert them into scope of work
Be a thought leader and coach the junior team members in the wide variety of statistical/predictive methods (e.g. DL, VAE, Bayesian nets etc) to attack a given prediction use-case
Build, mentor and lead a team of applied research scientists and data scientists
Self-drive knowledge accumulation of methods and modeling advances by reading research publications, blogs and attending presentations and webinars
Basic Qualifications:
Graduate (Masters/Phd) degree in engineering, information or STEM disciplines
7+ years of experience conducting statistical, research-minded analysis of variety of data types/forms with aim to utilize this analysis into building or optimizing predictive methods
5+ years’ experience in programming with languages such as Python, R, Julia
4+ years of deep, hands-on experience with machine Learning applied to the healthcare, energy, Retail, industrial AI, Aerospace or other high-stakes domains (direct experience in a cloud environment is highly valued)
Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in scripting languages and utilities such as CLI tools, awk, sed, perl, regex etc.
Experience with one or many of these topics such in customer churn, intent prediction, disease/damage progression, anomaly detection, sequence-based models, time-series forecasting or time to event modeling
Experience in deploying machine learning models in a production setting (logging, monitoring, alerts) in a cloud environment
Exposure to extracting and manipulating data via tool/libraries/forms such as Spark, pandas, scikit family, numpy/scipy, matplotlib, streamlit

Description:
The Optum Care Network Pacific Northwest (OCN PNW) Senior Quality Improvement Data Analyst is responsible for leading all analytics and data driven solutions by understanding and interpreting complex programs, initiatives, and data through the employment of advanced analytics techniques, business requirements gathering, project management techniques, business systems analysis, and reporting using a variety of reporting platforms, systems, sources, and data formats.

The Senior Quality Improvement Data Analyst will work closely within the Quality team and in collaboration with other technical, operational and clinical lane teams to understand business requirements, project deliverables, technical solutions, and short-term objectives and long-term goals. They will lead investigative analytics, the employment of statistical analytics, and technical solutions for all Quality programs. Along with Program Managers and leadership, they will lead the collaboration with other close business units on the program and project structures, data gathering and transformation methodology, and analytical standards to ensure reporting accuracy, data integrity, and process efficiency. They will lead and mentor other business analysts to prioritize asks, provide strategic recommendations, and to develop and drive Quality subject matter expertise and technical skills development.

Optum Care Network creates the opportunity for independent private practitioners to thrive in Washington State. By providing clinical integration support and data driven quality improvement, we have created a high value delivery network, making it possible for our providers to remain focused squarely on their patients.

Status: Regular, Full-time, FLSA Exempt
Competitive Pay and Benefits
Location: Hybrid, working remote and in person at the Seattle or SeaTac offices 1-2 times per week.
Responsibilities:
Lead the efforts to gather business requirements for the design, development, and enhancement of analytics, reporting, and data driven solutions for all Quality programs
Participate in strategic project initiatives, including the design, development, testing, implementation, and ongoing support across the entire life cycle of the project or program
Analyze complex datasets across disparate sources, and propose solutions and recommendations to both existing and new programs and projects
Development of standardized business processes to identify, document, and deliver on analytical and data driven solutions
Supervise the development and advancement of technical skillsets and business subject matter expertise of other business analysts and Quality team members
Develop and maintain knowledge of key performance indicators related to Quality including but not limited to CMS Stars, HEDIS, etc.
Supervise the development and progress of all investigative analytics and ad hoc requests both within the Quality team and in collaboration with other business units and technical teams
Partner with Quality leadership and associated business units to provide business insights, information, projections, and recommendations
Gather and clearly define and communicate business requirements and project goals
Develop methods to support the access, storage, and reporting of data sets that support project initiatives
Effectively visualize and communicate the risks, insights, patterns, and trends from complex and disparate reports and sources, and provide recommendations based on subject matter expertise
Develop and conduct quality control audits and test requirements to ensure accuracy of data and expected outcomes of programs and projects
Identify, correct, and/or assist in resolution of project and program risks
Collaborate directly with internal and external business units to identify opportunities to enhance program outcomes
Perform data scrubbing, troubleshooting, quality checking, and usability analysis to identify anomalies which need to be addressed prior to delivery of program and initiative results
Other duties as assigned
Basic Qualifications:
Strong ability to coach, mentor, and train analysts on technical skills and business subject matter as it impacts Quality programs and strategies
Intermediate to Advanced skill level with Microsoft SQL programming language
Intermediate to Advanced skill level with Microsoft Excel
Intermediate to Advanced skill level with business intelligence platforms (PowerBI, SSRS, Crystal Reports, Tableau, MS Access etc.)
High working level and knowledge of Microsoft software suite including Word, PowerPoint, Project, PowerPoint, Visio
Understanding of medical terminology and familiarity with medical records and healthcare information systems
Ability to interact and communicate effectively with healthcare providers
Excellent communication and meeting facilitation skills
Strong written skills (process documentation, software documentation, SBAR, etc.)
Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize work, multi-task across many projects and priorities independently
Ability to prioritize all analytics deliverables in collaboration with other business analysts and team members
Working knowledge of the provider-based healthcare industry and Quality strongly preferred
Preferred Qualifications:
Education:
Degree and/or a professional certification (preferred)

Experience:

Three years’ experience in healthcare industry or related field which includes direct or indirect work with public health certificate/coursework, claims management systems, EMR platforms, healthcare regulations, Quality MA/HHS, project management, data visualization, or other clinical related background (preferred)
Experience with training, mentoring, or professional development of other peers or analysts

Certifications:
AHIMA Certified Health Data Analyst (CHDA) preferred.

For you, quality counts. For UnitedHealthcare, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, delivering quality care starts with processes and documentation standards that are the best in our industry. As a Data Analyst 2, you’ll be a force for positive change, guiding the development of comprehensive care plans that will help others live healthier lives. Positions in this function are responsible for the management and manipulation of mostly structured data, with a focus on building business intelligence tools, conducting analyses to distinguish patterns and recognize trends, performing normalization operations and assuring data quality. Depending on the specific role and business line, example responsibilities in this function could include creating specifications to bring data into a common structure, creating product specifications and models, developing data solutions to support analyses, performing analyses, interpreting results, developing actionable insights and presenting recommendations for use by the plan. Roles in this function could partner with stakeholders to understand data requirements and develop tools and models such as segmentation, dashboards, data visualizations, decision aids and business case analysis to support the organization. Other roles involved could include producing and managing the delivery of activity and value analytics to external stakeholders and clients. Team members will typically use business intelligence, data visualization, query, analytic and statistical software to build solutions, perform analysis and interpret data.

Work with data submitters to ensure minimum information required for clinical use case is included in or enriched on ADT messages
This includes facility NPI, provider NPI, Facility name, provider name, place of service and observation stay indicators
Align place of service (Acute Care Hospital, Skilled Nursing, Acute inpatient rehab) from ADTs to trigger the correct workflows in care management systems

Lead a task force to ensure unwanted Discharge Notifications (Navi, post acute) are filtered out
Inpatient admit notifications other than hospitals

Monitor the data quality; compare the overall admits using claims data to the actual admits coming from ADT
Monthly invoicing based on agreed up data quality dimensions
Monitoring metrics on data utilization by downstream systems for different business use cases
Ensure that internal quality processes are followed and producing verification and validation plans, test reports, and other documentation that complies with regulatory requirements
Drive defect, incident and problem management by interrogating data bases and processing logs to investigate data integrity and accuracy issues

1+ years of experience with integration technologies including: Ensemble, Cache, HealthShare or other interoperability platforms such as Mirth, Orion Rhapsody, Cloverleaf, eGate, JCAPS, InterSystems, Optum, etc.
1+ years of extensive knowledge of SQL and clinical data analysis
Knowledgeable in industry standard patterns, practices and technologies (e.g. SaaS, Web Services, SOA, Big Data technologies, Mobile, PaaS, etc.)
Experience in healthcare vertical such as EMR, Health Insurance, Acute care, Post-Acute, Health Systems, and HIE

Experience with complete software development life cycle

Knowledge of clinical data formats (HL7, C32, CCDA, ORU)

Description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

You are a thought leader who thrives on developing new solutions to solve tough challenges. As a critical member of our business analysis team, you will help rewrite the future of UnitedHealth Group. Here, your analytical and innovative skills will help us with our mission of helping people live healthier lives. Yes, we share a mission that inspires. Positions in this function are responsible for the management and manipulation of mostly structured data, with a focus on building business intelligence tools, conducting analysis, performing normalization operations and assuring data quality. Depending on the specific role and business line, example responsibilities in this function could include creating specifications to bring data into a common structure, creating product specifications and models, developing data solutions to support analyses, performing analysis interpreting results, developing actionable insights and presenting recommendations for use across the company. Roles in this function could partner with stakeholders to understand data requirements and develop tools and models such as segmentation, dashboards, data visualizations, decision aids and business case analysis to support the organization. Other roles involved could include producing and managing the delivery of activity and value analytics to external stakeholders and clients. Team members will typically use business intelligence, data visualization, query, analytic and statistical software to build solutions, perform analysis and interpret data. Positions in this function work on predominately descriptive and regression-based analytics and tend to leverage subject matter expert views in the design of their analytics and algorithms.
Responsibilities:
Uses pertinent data and facts to identify and solve a range of problems within area of expertise.
Investigates non-standard requests and problems, with some assistance from others.
Works exclusively within a specific knowledge area .
Prioritizes and organizes own work to meet deadlines.
Provides explanations and information to others on topics within area of expertise
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Description:
This opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: Optum – a growing part of our family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a Fortune 5 leader. Optum Analytics solutions create a longitudinal view of both individual patients and patient populations. We gather, normalize, and analyze data from disparate sources that, uniquely, span the continuum of care--including EHRs, Practice Management Systems and claims. Our EHR data alone accounts for over 80M patient lives across the U.S.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Job Title:
Principal Data Analyst, QA, Genomics - Telecommute
Optum  Eden Prairie, MN Remote
Description:
UnitedHealth Group is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

OptumLabs serves as UnitedHealth Group’s research and development hub. Our vision is to create the most effective, affordable, equitable, and engaging health care solutions that improve patient health outcomes and experience, enhance provider experience, bolster health equity, and make health care more affordable. Our teams leverage big data insights, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and disruptive product development while capitalizing on engineering, clinical, and scientific innovations to build innovative health solutions.

OptumLabs has partnered with Optum Genomics to drive data strategy for genomics research and product use cases. The Optum Genomics team is committed to sourcing high-quality genomics data to inform a more complete view of health and to facilitate the evidence needed to get impactful genomics products into the clinic quickly and responsibly. It is imperative that this data be linked to clinical and claims data at scale and enriched with normalized and contextualized genomic features. Having access to this linked and enriched data allows researchers to understand and generate clinical utility evidence for genomic testing that is driven by real-world clinical outcomes. This evidence will open the door for more extensive use of genomics for precision medicine to improve patient care.

Our team will be responsible for developing a robust linked data asset and operationalizing this data for use in a variety of product and research use cases. We seek a Principal Data Analyst, QA to provide support for data strategy and data management activities with a special focus on data quality surrounding data linking processes, existing data pipelines, and features extracted from existing lab data.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Responsibilities
Partner with Optum Genomics, OptumInsight, and OptumTech to understand existing platforms, tools, and processes to define and execute a plan for systematic improvements to drive increased data quality and engineering efficiency related to internal genomics data, genomics data linking processes, and genomics feature extraction
Work with the technical product owner to develop roadmaps, prioritize backlogs, lead proof of concept, etc. to improve data quality processes, create efficiencies and deliver high-quality data products
Be involved with upstream data providers and downstream data users to understand quality requirements, identify and cure data quality gaps and drive a high level of customer service and overall level of customer satisfaction
Be a data and data quality Subject Matter Expert (SME) across our enterprise data product portfolio and drive adoption of best practice data quality, data governance and data management techniques across that portfolio
Evaluate and quantify business impact of data quality issues, making recommendations for data improvements including required process and system changes, communicate value realized through data improvement efforts
You must love healthcare data and data quality and be able to mentor/teach and communicate the value and rationale of different data needs, enrichments, and data use cases
Basic Qualifications:
3 + years of experience conducting hands-on data quality analysis and root cause investigations for reoccurring data product deliveries
3+ years healthcare data knowledge and understanding across multiple data asset types (e.g. administrative claims, hospital billing/discharge, EMR, inventory/supplies for healthcare, etc.)
1+ year experience writing SQL or similar to conduct data quality analysis
Experience finding and resolving data issues, (NOT application testing, ETL or BI development) for data assets, warehouses or data/analytic products with client delivery accountability
Experience with downstream use of data and analytics in a healthcare business or clinical setting
Preferred Qualifications:
1+ year experience with analytical and reporting tools (SQL, SAS/Python/R, Tableau, etc.)
Experience working with genomics data
Experience operating and evolving data quality tools, processes and practices, and acting in a consultative capacity to drive effective use/adoption of those capabilities
Experience interfacing with software and/or platform development teams
Experience working in an ambiguous, complex environment and assisting in creating order, clear roadmaps, and a path forward
Experience working in highly matrixed organizations; natural collaborator
Healthcare data and data models experience
Ability to mentor/teach and communicate the value and rationale of different data needs, enrichments, and data model approaches
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance

Description:

Solutran is a leading FinTech company committed to creating game-changing, customer-friendly solutions. We serve health-seeking populations by partnering with the nation’s largest health plans, government programs, such as WIC and SNAP, as well as with employers and retailers. We’ve established a reputation for delivering modern, advanced customer experiences through best-in-class solutions used by millions.

Solutran has grown over four times in size in the last couple of years. As a result, in January we became part of the Optum Financial family (a part of UnitedHealth Group). The Solutran team and our platform are now at the center of the most significant healthcare payments innovation in modern history. The journey is just beginning. We expect this growth to accelerate and invite you to grow with us!

Solutran is seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst who is experienced in using SQL to work with our high performing and highly collaborative Operations team. If you are a detail-oriented, motivated project manager, who thrives on a diverse set of job responsibilities, then your skills are needed as a Project Manager in our PMO team.

As part of the project team your project management skills and attention to detail will be used across a spectrum of project management activities. Your role will involve a variety of activities that will require skills such as project management, business analysis, data analysis, project quality, and departmental performance monitoring. You may also be asked to apply different project management methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, or Hybrid.

You will provide project management and business analysis for a variety of medium to large projects – with activities and artifacts including: project scope document, project schedule, IRAADs, status reports, presentations, meeting scheduling, agendas & minutes, roles & responsibilities, quality tracking, issue or conflict resolution, and stakeholder management.

You will create and document performance to quality measures ensuring that our projects are following repeatable, reliable processes and methods. Additionally, the person in this role will be assigned to testing requests, to support and lead End-to-End and User Acceptance Testing planning, configuration, and execution as needed.
Responsibilities:
Responsible project execution working with teams from various functional areas. Experience in Healthcare operations preferred
Partner with leadership team assigned to each initiative
Coordinate directly with prospective client executives and internal Optum stakeholders to manage projects. This responsibility will require client facing communications, executive-level presence, and storyboarding and presentation skills
Create deliverables related to pursuit strategy and operating cadence, project status, risks, and expected results. Plan and deliver well-structured oral and written communications, highlighting strategic opportunities
Provide subject matter expertise in areas including project scope definition, risk identification, project methodology, timeline and work plan details, resource gaps, and other areas of expertise based on established project management techniques
Ensure alignment and understanding of program / project scope and objectives with the organization's strategic objectives, in consultation with applicable stakeholders
Raise awareness of any misalignment or misunderstanding of project scope and objectives with applicable stakeholders
Ensure that all impacted areas are identified, and that appropriate resources are engaged to participate in the scope definition process
Ensure that project scope, requirements and approvals comply with existing governance guidelines and methodology
Ensure that all project dependencies / linkages are identified (e.g., cross-functional area dependencies, implementation timelines, value proposition overlap areas, etc.)
Apply consultative thinking and mindset to advise the client and internal stakeholders
Performs all other related duties as assigned
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Health Care Administration, Business Administration or a related field required. (4 additional years of comparable work experience beyond the required years of experience may be substituted in lieu of a bachelor’s degree).
5+ years project management experience
2+ years of experience in managing highly complex cross-functional projects or due diligence efforts with significant leadership / executive-level exposure
Healthcare technology understanding
Storyboarding skills
Expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and SharePoint
Collaborate with counterparts to support work associated with multiple / simultaneous clients
Adaptability and ability to pivot based on new information, shifting timelines and client needs
Ability to build relationships with internal stakeholders at various levels (executives, senior-level BAL and PDL roles, client executives, client admin and PMO staff, internal project managers, etc.)
Travel up to 25%
Hybrid / Office based position. Will consider candidates based in Denver or Colorado Springs
Preferred Qualifications:
Certification: Project Management Professional (PMP)®, Program Management Professional (PgMP)® or Portfolio Management Professional (PfMP)® certification preferred, also Lean / Six Sigma Black Belt accredited certification or Scrum Master Certification
Allscripts experience
EMR experience ( EPIC, Cerner, etc..)
Creative, strategic thinker with excellent critical thinking skills
Appetite for tackling the demands of a high-performance environment

Active listening skills, problem-solving skills, judgment, and presence

Experience in designing and/or implementation of a QMS for credentialed certification: FDA 510K, ISO 9000, IEC 62304, etc.

As a Digital Health Launch Readiness Project Manager, you'll work to not only challenge the status quo, but change it. The Optum Center for Digital Health is building the world’s most comprehensive, digital, information and AI-enabled care model of the future blending virtual and in person care. Our care model is designed to achieve better outcomes, provide better experiences for patients and providers, while reducing the cost of care, through a “customer-centric” approach, in an agile, innovative environment.

In this role, you'll lead strategic initiatives among business teams and operating groups for critical projects focused on delivering products and services for our new model of care. You'll be a subject matter expert in leading teams through scope definition, planning, stakeholder identification, mapping dependencies, risk management and execution of the work through application of project management methodology. You will support short and long term operational strategic business activities by developing, enhancing and maintaining operational information and models. You will also develop and implement effective strategic business solutions through research and analysis of data and business processes. This is your opportunity to take your career to the next level as you work directly with senior leadership.

The Digital Health Launch Readiness Project Manager is an individual contributor with project-based work critical to maintaining momentum, managing partnerships, and supporting new initiatives that drive results that align to the Canter for Digital Health strategic priorities.
Responsibilities:
Independently manage projects of varying levels of complexity from kickoff through launch, with limited management oversight
Lead or contribute to the development of program or project scope statements with applicable stakeholders (e.g., program/project charter, Statement of Work)
Identify project duration, effort, sequence, and dependencies of tasks required to meet applicable project objectives
Drive/participate in the process, as appropriate
Monitor and document project milestones and outcomes throughout the project lifecycle to ensure adherence to established quality standards
Develop, communicate, and implement program and project risk, issue management plans and strategies
Develop and implement contingency and recovery plans when deliverables are missed (e.g., identify critical path, document, plan for getting back on plan schedule, Business Continuity Plan, failover planning)
Develop and maintain various project status reporting including proving verbal and written updates across a wide range of stakeholders
Acts as a centralized facilitating point for the coordination of tasks and integrated execution of key strategic initiatives and reduces activities carried out in isolation
Facilitate events and meetings for internal and external participants
Anticipate and proactively gather information regarding trends and upcoming asks
Exercise critical thinking and problem solving skills to drive significant business impact and customer satisfaction
Identify potential risk or problems proactively and drive resolution across cross-functional teams
Influence and manage group relationships with diverse geographic locations, skills and level of understanding of company processes and policy
Manage in a flexible, changing, and virtual environment, with the ability to be ready to adjust plans and direction in response to local feedback and the iterative nature of digital health projects
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of project management experience - managing multiple complex projects through launch
3+ years clinical experience with focus in project management or business operations
3+ years of progressive responsibility with process improvement initiatives
3+ years of experience leading and influencing cross-functional teams including interfacing with leadership
2+ years of experience with Agile methodology
Advanced level of proficiency with Smartsheet, Visio, PowerPoint, SharePoint and Teams
Ability to travel up to 25% to partner directly with care delivery organizations
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration
PMP or CAPM certification
Lean Six Sigma certification
Black belt training
Experience with Epic technology platform
Experience with Aha technology platform
Experience using Rally
In-clinic experience
Experience working with digital product development

Description: As the Business Analyst Consultant, you will be tasked with helping our regional care teams drive value and improve outcomes in the assigned markets as Level2 continues to scale across the country. This role oversees the execution of business objectives and general operations in the care team markets and helping adjust as needed to meet our goals. You will be responsible for exploring and operationalizing new ways to drive value, recommending changes and driving toward success, and working with key internal and external constituents to realize defined objectives. This role is a key part of the business operations team, facilitating alignment between business priorities and operational build out areas to enable the business to scale faster and grow efficiently
Responsibilities:

Support cross-functional collaboration, encouraging creative solutions and strategies and emphasizing outcomes and cost
Demonstrate resourcefulness in moving work forward, finding and harnessing resources, and meeting tight timelines

2+ years’ work experience
Great analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities
Ability to work collaboratively and diplomatically with external and internal constituents gaining consensus/support and managing stakeholder input/approval
Strong adaptability and capacity to work in fast-paced environments
Possess advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills
Demonstrated leadership, academic performance and intellectual curiosity

Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively verbally and in writing

Job Title: Senior Business Strategy Analyst - Pharmacy and Specialty Distribution
Description: As a Senior Business Strategy Analyst of Pharmacy and Specialty Distribution, you will be responsible for collecting and analyzing data for potential business expansion. This will include working with pharmaceutical manufacturers, as well as working across the UnitedHealth Group enterprise of companies. You will use data driven results to help determine what areas of specialty distribution OFT invests in for the future. Data results will also drive OFT expansion decisions as it relates to physical warehouse space. The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will also be responsible for developing reports that are required in our data agreements with manufacturing partners. This role does not reside within IT, but rather sits inside the business and directly works with leadership to support deal evaluation. This role will also communicate with IT as needed, and be responsible for leading data project activities, assisting in the launch of new distribution agreements, conducting team meetings, establishing and maintaining timelines, and communications to all levels of stakeholders. This role will also be responsible for the development of a CRM tool that supports the various sales teams (provider, manufacturer and distribution) in order to develop a contact database and track activity to improve sales.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with sales leadership and finance teams to design, and implement a sales incentive plan within budget that achieves sales goals and motivates the sales team
Work with internal resources to recommend and implement a customer relationship management tool and a sales reporting tool for tracking sales performance.
Analyze and report sales data and achievement of sales targets on a timely basis
Support operational and business analytics, process improvement data deep-dives, and the identification and execution of new opportunities to drive increases in efficiency and performance
Leverage market and customer research, trends, and competitor analysis to drive revenue, increase profitability, grow market share and enhance customer loyalty.
Manage Manufacturer data to ensure compliance with fee-for-service arrangements.
Develop innovative analytic solutions, create actionable insights, and drive better decisions and performance to help the organization achieve its objectives
Detail orientated – getting "into the trenches" to evaluate all aspects of operations; pivotal to success will be the ability to take a hands-on approach to getting the information needed and driving effective and lasting change
Develop visionary and creative analytic solutions to measure business performance; identify / quantify drivers, risks, and opportunities and define solutions to mitigate risks and leverage opportunities
Influence senior leadership to adopt new ideas, projects and/or approaches
Goal-directed, persistent, and driven to achieve positive results; positive influence on others and deals well with setbacks; identifies integration issues, removes barriers, and tracks project status in order to obtain desired results
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in reporting and analysis, data management, and reconciliation, with at least 3 of those years in a corporate setting, preferably in the healthcare services or specialty pharmacy services
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field
2+ years of direct working experience with a CRM platform, such as Salesforce.com
2+ years of experience working with Microsoft Power BI, or other advanced analytical tools such as Qlik Sense, Oracle Analytics Cloud, Tableau, ThoughtSpot, or SAP
External client-facing and/or account management or vendor management experience
Experience developing and delivering formal presentations
Proven history of implementing and executing successful business ideas into action.
Proficient skills in Microsoft Office
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience leading a team of direct reports or demonstrated ability to manage and develop team members
Experience with Pharmacy Utilization Data

Description: As a Business Analyst/System Administrator supporting our OnBase application, you'll have the opportunity design, implement, and troubleshoot OnBase solutions to support key operations and business objectives. This is a position that affords you the ability to provide our customers with customized solutions to meet their business needs. By using your unique blend of technical aptitude and business acumen to support OnBase, you will have an impact on healing the health care system. This is a challenging role that creates an opportunity to grow and develop while doing your life's best work.

Description: As a Business Analyst Consultant, you will lead projects and investigations into key business problems through quantitative analyses of coordination of benefits rules and applications. In this role, you will interpret and analyze data from various sources and recommend best approaches for new solutions. Your analyses will be used to create viable, real-world solutions in a complex health care landscape. The work is as challenging as it is rewarding. You'll open doors to new opportunities. This is where bold people with big ideas are writing the next chapter in health care.
Responsibilities:
Lead projects to completion by assisting leaders, peers, and business/data analysts in researching and implementing solutions to business challenges
Act as a liaison between leadership and staff to streamline communication and organization of projects

Ability to identify and refine criteria to successfully increase efficiency of algorithm logic

Interpret and analyze claims and membership data

3+ years of work experience in a corporate setting
2+ years of health care experience working with claims data and medical codes
2+ years of experience in Tableau reporting
2+ years of leading complex projects

Job Title: Sr Business Analyst, Quality Reporting Operations
Description: QSD combines talented individuals from many areas of quality. Our goal is extraordinary performance that exceeds the expectations of the constituents, customers and members we serve.  As a Reporting Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing, reviewing and reporting data related to HEDIS® measure rate reporting.  You’ll be expected to interpret and analyze large amounts of data from multiple sources and use it to tell a meaningful story. This position will conduct analysis and comparison of HEDIS® reporting data, as well as troubleshooting data anomalies sourced from multiple platforms.  This position will be expected to command an understanding of data processing software applications and warehouse storage environments.  All work supports Commercial, Medicare & Medicaid quality improvement programs.  This position reports to the Manager, QVSD Quality Reporting Operations
Responsibilities:
QA/analysis of large data sets used for reporting and QA/analysis of subsequent deliverables
Respond to client inquiries regarding rate results, data completeness/quality and review member/provider specific concerns. Identify and trouble-shoot anomalies in production process and subsequent deliverables
Develop solutions and process efficiencies to improve delivery times, quality and completeness
Gather and document requirements from the client/business while focused on process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and/or evaluation of business processes
Communicate analysis including trends and opportunities to clients and the business in writing and verbally to solve complex business problems while negotiating multiple daily priorities 
Work with relational databases, database structures and SLQ queries on a daily basis
Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks
Develop & produce ad-hoc reports
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree  or equivalent experience
3+ years of demonstrated and recent experience reading/writing medium to complex SQL queries
2+ years of experience and working knowledge in healthcare data analysis related to quality reporting and metrics
Health care industry experience with claims, member or provider data
Experience with HEDIS® and/or Clinical Measures and related technical specifications/requirements
Intermediate level of proficiency in MS Excel
Excellent communication, time/project management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Intermediate level of proficiency in Tableau, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS or equivalent)
Exposure to Big Data environments
Advanced level of proficiency in MS Excel
Advanced level of proficiency in Transact SQL

If you are a highly motivated individual with a genuine interest in operational compliance and a passion to create standardized processes that allow our clients to focus on increasing their business, we have the perfect job for you. As a Transparency Business Consultant with OptumRx, you will help rewrite the future of the health care system. You'll deliver the best processes that impact thousands of clients with millions of lives. Along with ground-breaking challenge, you'll have the support and resources of a Fortune 7 company. Join us.

Description: Our Rotational Leadership Program is designed specifically for highly talented MBA candidates who have a strong desire to demonstrate their capabilities and enhance their leadership potential. You will be placed in strategic positions with frequent exposure to leaders, businesses, and technologies. You will have the ability to make meaning contributions to the company and help people live healthier lives.
Responsibilities:
Optum Payment Integrity and Call & Claim business consists of over 20,000 employees worldwide. Our 24-month program consists of two assignments (12 months each) in different business and geographic locations, providing you with a broad understanding of Payer Operations within the organization.

You’ll be exposed to managing Optum Payer top executional priorities which will utilize your strategic planning, critical thinking, global mindset, program, and project management skills.

Participants will also experience extensive, customized formal development programs to fulfill professional and personal potential. This role will allow you the opportunity to interact with senior leaders and build a valuable network of peers, managers, and leaders across the organization.
Basic Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree from an accredited institution
Currently pursuing an MBA from a top tier program with a target graduation date no later than June 2022. (Or have graduated with MBA in past two years)
Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization (F-1 students with practical training and candidates requiring H-1Bs, TNs, etc. will not be considered)
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.

3-5 years of relevant professional work experience

Operations experience or operations focused educational background
Demonstrated success at leading teams
Ability to quickly understand complex business issues and make strategic decisions
Thrive in team-based culture and fast changing environment
High emotional intelligence, ability to navigate a complex matrix organization
Innovative & proactive thinker
Business acumen & global mindset
