Project or program management, healthcare, marketing and/or IT background a plus

Job Title: Solutran Technical Business Analyst, Retail Integration
Description:
As a Retail Integration Technical Business Analyst at Solutran, you will play a key role in our S3 network expansion and implement systems that contribute to the network’s best-in-class availability and transaction processing integrity. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical and technical background to troubleshoot, support, and enhance a complex transaction processing infrastructure. This person will also be comfortable providing technical guidance and support to transaction processing developers at both Solutran and our merchant partners.

In this role you will collect, collate, and translate business requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria that can be built into quality software by our development teams. You will be an active thought partner and subject matter expert, deeply involved in new projects that provide our clients and users with an unmatched set of products and services.
Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain S3 retailer integration specification and supporting documentation
Act as lead technical contact for merchants for POS integration projects
Assist in transaction processing platform QA and testing for merchant and Solutran development projects
Troubleshoot transaction, benefit, and settlement processing issues and anomalies
Assist in merchant production implementations and ongoing support
Work with product teams to improve and enhance the S3 transaction processing infrastructure
Design and implement controls that will ensure 100% S3 transaction processing platform quality and availability
Performs all activities in a manner consistent with Solutran’s core principles
Basic Qualifications:
2+ years of Business Analyst/Associate Product Management experience or equivalent
Proven experience working with software engineering teams
Experience delivering complex, powerful products that are made simple for users, delivering successful results
Advanced SQL query writing experience
Proven experience testing complex software platforms
Experience with JIRA and SCRUM
SOAP/JSON web service design, testing and support
Knowledge of financial transaction processing concepts and message types
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum software development, writing use cases, user stories and detailed acceptance criteria
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Associate degree in a STEM related major
Ability to interact, collaborate and communicate with individuals at all levels both internally to the Solutran organization and externally as needed

Description: In this role as a Business System Analyst, you will be a thought leader in developing innovative solutions to automate the state file process and you will develop tools to expedite work for the business analysts (data dictionaries, simplified version of file layouts, macros and crosswalks, etc). You will be responsible for cross training technical applications and programming code used to support the state file process for C&S Health Plans. You will develop an audit trail safety net, and cross train on the location paths, etc. and you may be asked to support some operations application building.

Works with customers to define and document additional requirements and efficiency innovations to enrich reporting capabilities
Develops systematic reporting processes and procedures to ensure timely delivery of daily, weekly, monthly, annual and ad hoc reporting to management
Troubleshoots data integrity issues, analyzes data for completeness to meet business needs, and proposes documented solution recommendations
Transfers data into meaningful, professional and easy to understand formats for various audiences
With little direction, manages reporting and analysis elements on all business initiative projects
Basic Qualifications:
3+ years of professional experience with Relational Database Management Systems (such as Oracle, Sybase, SQL Server)
1+ years of professional experience performing Data Analytics and Reporting (such as SSIS/SSRS)
1+ years of professional experience with source control (Git/GitHub/TFS)
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree
Experience with provider data within the Healthcare Industry
Solid T-SQL Skills

You will consult with users and technology specialists to define business processes and the information systems for supporting those processes. You may perform analysis and also serve as business liaisons to understand and refine business requirements. You will provide technical support in developing systems that are cost effective and meet users’ requirements. You will work to create systems that work together in a cohesive manner, enforcing standards and methods consistently across the enterprise. Produce, publish and distribute scheduled and ad-hoc client and operational reports relating to the development and performance of products, processes and technologies

We are part of the Strategic Planning and Analysis team, which comprises approximately 30 employees supporting the finance, reporting, strategic planning, communication and project needs of Corporate Services. Description: This Business Analyst Consultant will perform the Routing Analyst role supporting and enhancing call technology for Optum Care. The individual in this position is responsible for end-to-end business process activities related to the ongoing implementations and maintenance of the ONNI/Genesys telephony system across multiple markets. This position will represent the business side of requirement building, design and architecture when meeting with the implementation/delivery teams. Will lead the efforts in the creation, implementation, and evaluation of migrations, integrations and all day 2 activities. They will create strategic and reusable standards for routing solutions ranging from small to multi-month projects through requirements gathering, solution design, user story creation, testing and analytics. They work closely with agile team members to ensure the team delivers value to the business and ensures a best-in-class caller experience. In addition, this individual may also work on Omni-Channel support requests and other special projects as requested by leadership. This Routing Analyst will work to support strategic plans for the technologies impacting the Optum Care service call centers. This individual is a self-starter; with the ability to identify and pursue opportunities with limited direction. Solid communication skills, analytic skills and a passion for improving consumer experiences using technology are essential.

Manage and support existing Optum Care telecom capabilities and features
Support the development of new solutions that generate value, scalability, control, risk mitigation and/or a unified experience to customers
Support key strategic initiatives and provides program leadership for large, complex programs in order to ensure programs and strategies are implemented and maintained effectively
Participate in and/or lead, as appropriate, process/workflow analysis and enhancements to support requirements
Discuss and resolve business data, and process issues within the team(s), across stakeholders
Research/analyze data and business processes, as needed, via quantitative and qualitative analysis for requirements and to support solutioning
Lead and/or support internal review sessions with all levels, including senior leadership
Build relationships and leverage a network of experts–internal and external–that enhance innovation and performance
Remove obstacles and manage remediation of business problems that impact delivery of products, customer satisfaction, and quality
Collaborate with project stakeholders and technical teams regarding enhancements, changes, issues and defects that may impact development, data, workflow and/or functionality
Demonstrates a self-starter attitude and be eager to experiment, invite and explore the potential in new ideas while understanding and mitigating the risk to the organization
Be recognized as a quality subject matter expert for the Optum Care Omni

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - Accounting Operations and Analysis
Description:
The Accounting Operations and Analysis (AOA) Sr. Business Analyst will have a full proficiency and understanding of the PeopleSoft ERP system across various user modules (Contracts, Project Costing, Billing, and Revenue). Support the PS ERP product end users to ensure day-to-day functions and processes are performing effectively and efficiently. Analyst scope of work includes leading migration efforts to move businesses from their current billing tool to ERP.

Responsible for functionality testing and process improvement of related tools and creating procedure documentation related to new functionality or process changes. Support short and long term operational / strategic business activities - by developing, enhancing, and maintaining operational systems and process.
Responsibilities:
Effectively and confidently communicate with technology & business stakeholders regarding change management and process
Analyze and balance risk/reward considerations for identified solutions
Troubleshoot system or process issues then provide feedback and suggestions in order create efficiencies
Perform PeopleSoft ERP functional testing
Provide ongoing support to ensure proper implementation and adoption of a solution (Post-deployment support and monitoring of process plans)
Create and execute quality testing strategy for system enhancements
Attend scrum meetings, standups, retrospectives, and demos as needed to collaborate with system development partners
Model business processes (current and future)
Provide training on new business process
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in business, finance, or related field
3+ years of relevant work experience
PeopleSoft ERP Experience
Ability to lead conversations with business partners about the capabilities, functions, and processes of ERP
Able to identify gaps or risks of a business process and able to create a recommended solution from either an enhancement or process improvement standpoint
Ability to analyze large sets of data with the purpose of preparing such data for migrations to ERP
Ability to lead a project from inception to deployment (including post deployment support)
Intermediate level of proficiency with PC based software programs (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Visio)
Demonstrated excellence in communication, time and project management, problem solving, organization, and analysis skills
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience Developing Requirements
Migration experience moving a business from one financial tool to another
Process Improvement with Six Sigma or Lean initiatives
Skilled at problem solving, follow-through, and resolution

Description: As a Sr. Business Analyst, you will be empowered to support short and long term operational/strategic business activities; develop, enhance and maintain operational information and models that will have an impact on business decisions. Join us! Your passion for performance can fuel your life's best work. (sm)

Conduct and manage outcomes of various studies that include analyzing, reviewing, and presenting information for operational and business planning.
Gather business requirements and manage large, complex projects that span the entire organization.

Description:
UnitedHealthcare Government Programs (UHGP) Pharmacy Services Management team provides pharmacy operations services and is responsible for executing core plan side pharmacy operations activities in conjunction with UHGP’s first-tier, downstream and related entities (FDR).

UHGP Pharmacy Services Management team is searching for a candidate with experience in pharmacy operations business analysis in a Health Plan or Pharmacy Benefit Management setting, to join our team as an Associate Exchange Business Analyst in Minnetonka, MN or Baltimore, MD. In this growth-oriented role, you will report to the Business Process Consultant, UHC Government Programs - Pharmacy and play a key role in building the capabilities of the Pharmacy Services Management team. Use your Sharp Analytical Skills to help us support, compile and report key information!
Responsibilities:
Provide technical, process, and analytical expertise to support implementation and ongoing management of the UHGP exchange business
Support annual benefit & system set-up processes
Ensure delegated entity functionality exists to meet new or changing federal and/or state exchange requirements
Review and validate testing after benefit set-up completion
Provide input into the ongoing set-up & maintenance of the eligibility data connection between CSP & RxClaim (claims adjudication system)
Develop and manage processes to ensure accuracy of individual & family eligibility, including accurate grace period
Support review, analysis and validation of Exchange related pharmacy materials & portals, including but not limited to network data displaying on internal and state or federal portals, and annual and ad-hoc materials
Serve as the subject matter expert to resolve exchange related escalated member issues
Support and oversee delegated aspects of the pharmacy benefit (e.g. prior authorizations, Pharmacy Help Desk, network accuracy & management)
Gather and develop requirements for process controls, reporting, monitoring, and efficiency
Collaborate cross-functionally and with intersegment partners, including OptumRx, to ensure implemented exchange elements meet regulatory, compliance, audit, and pharmacy business objectives
Basic Qualifications:
BA/BS in business or a related field or equivalent education and/or work experience
3+ years of experience in business analysis and business process analysis
3+ years of experience in healthcare/pharmacy related field, preferably pharmacy services or benefit management.
1+ ACA exchange pharmacy operations knowledge (e.g. eligibility, benefit set up, network setup, materials management, state/federal requirements) strongly desired
Ability to build strong business relationships and influence change across organizational lines
3+ years of experience with Microsoft Product Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access, Project)
Strong attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Problem solving skills
Planning and organizational skills
Strong analytical skills
Strong customer focus
Collaborative approach

Description:
The Lead Business Systems Analyst Serves as Application Support Process Owner, as designated by leadership, to apply knowledge of LHI’s applications and business to create, monitor, maintain and improve Application Support processes. The Lead Support Systems Analyst will be a servant leader who develops and supports a learning organization model through coaching, training, and mentorship. The Lead, Support Systems Analyst leads and fosters a highly collaborative team environment and provides input and structure on both tactical and strategic project activities.

Possess solid analytical and problem-solving skills and be able to problem solve and propose solutions

3+ years of root cause analysis with E2E research and remediation experience

Description: Positions in this function create and deliver high quality system solutions for our applications, products, and services across all technology functions. They consult with users and technology specialists to define business processes and the information systems for supporting those processes. Individuals in these roles may perform analysis and also serve as business liaisons to understand and refine business requirements. They provide technical support in developing systems that are cost effective and meet users’ requirements. This function works to create systems that work together in a cohesive manner, enforcing standards and methods consistently across the enterprise. Roles may support both current system improvements and maintenance along with new system development.
Responsibilities:
Own and shepherd your product areas and manage your features, stores, and defects from inception to done while meeting committed dates
Lead the collaboration with business customers to define scope for new projects, documents risks and assumptions, develops the delivery timeline and approach
Serve as a liaison between business clients and IT to gather business requirements and convert them to technical reporting requirements
Understand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders and facilitate driving project discovery sessions
Have awareness of the status of your product (feature, stories, blockers, testing, defects, acceptance, UAT, etc.) with respect to business commitments (release, etc.)

Communicate out your product

Be knowledgeable of the technical solution approach. Understand the high-level solution. Champion reuse of established patterns. Pursue technical consensus when new technical patterns are needed
Support the development team in getting your product done by a specific date
Be responsible for the quality of your product throughout the build and acceptance process
Be responsible for the cost of development of your product. You must contain scope
Be responsible for the marketing and presentation (articulate business value, be ready to demo, or provide a ppt, etc.) of your product
Ensure features and user stories are “ready” for development to start work. (defined, bounded, clear biz value, acceptance criteria, linked to living requirement documents)

Ensure ‘out of scope’ un-built items are documented in other features/stories
Work closely with engineering and quality engineering teams to ensure the right customer problem is solved
Gather requirements from multiple stakeholders; identify and understand business needs; elicit and clearly document requirement artifacts like user stories, source to target data mapping and use cases. Maintain your ‘living requirements’ documentation by keeping them up to date, accurate, and ensure your teams know how to navigate them
Become a SME in your capability/feature area
Create and maintain User Stories and Features; drive sprint planning for the scrum team and participate in scrum ceremonies
Collaboratively document test criteria, execute reporting test cases and document test results for UAT
Serves as a leader/mentor
Reviews the work of others
Sought out as expert
Serves as a leader/ mentor

Experience with business and requirements analysis and documenting business processes, user stories and data mapping
Experience working with Agile development methodology

Optum is seeking a Data Engineer with health care experience to implement and manage cross-domain, modular, flexible, scalable, secure, reliable and quality data solutions that transform data to support analytics and insight generation for our clients. The Data Engineer will implement, test, deploy, monitor, and maintain the delivery of data in a systematic method and will support a wide variety of analytical needs for our customers. The Director of Data Engineering will also partner with the broader OAS Analytics organization to harness the power of client data to facilitate analytical insight and will be responsible for building quality and efficiency into every project.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Support the full data engineering lifecycle including research, proof of concepts, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of data management solutions
Utilize knowledge of various data management technologies to drive data engineering projects
Lead data acquisition efforts to gather data from various structured or semi-structured source systems of record to hydrate client data warehouse and power analytics across numerous health care domains
Leverage combination of ETL/ELT methodologies to pull complex relational and dimensional data to support loading DataMart’s and reporting aggregates.
Eliminate unwarranted complexity and unneeded interdependencies
Detect data quality issues, identify root causes, implement fixes, and manage data audits to mitigate data challenges
Implement, modify, and maintain data integration efforts that improve data efficiency, reliability, and value

Leverage data pipeline monitoring tools to detect data integrity issues before they result into user visible outages or data quality issues
Leverage processes and diagnostics tools to troubleshoot, maintain and optimize solutions and respond to customer and production issues
Continuously support technical debt reduction, process transformation, and overall optimization
Leverage and contribute to the evolution of standards for high quality documentation of data definitions, transformations, and processes to ensure data transparency, governance, and security
Ensure that all solutions meet the business needs and requirements for security, scalability, and reliability

Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in information technology, engineering, math, computer science, analytics, engineering or other related field)
2+ years of combined experience in data engineering, ingestion, normalization, transformation, aggregation, structuring, and storage
2+ years of combined experience working with industry standard relational, dimensional or non-relational data storage systems
2+ years of experience in designing ETL/ELT solutions using tools like Informatica, DataStage, Health Catalyst, SSIS , PL/SQL, T-SQL, etc.
2+ years of experience in managing data assets using SQL, Python, Scala, Java, R or other similar querying/coding language
2+ years of experience working with healthcare data or data to support healthcare organizations
Preferred Qualifications:

Description:
Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)

Join Rally Health as a Data Engineer where you will partner with product managers and data consumers to meet our internal analytics and client data needs. You will use our modern data platform - which uses infrastructure and tools like Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, Spark, Databricks, Airflow, Amazon S3, and Amazon Redshift - to meet your goals. You will oversee the entire lifecycle of data pipeline development from data discovery and design to quality and maintenance. As part of the larger Data Engineering team, you will report to an Engineering Manager. We recognize that people come from diverse backgrounds and skills and welcome all to apply.

You will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Play an important role in the discovery, design, development, and validation of big data pipelines
Build scalable Spark pipelines for large-scale healthcare data
Build datasets and data products that support population health management and positive recommendations that allow individuals to improve their health and manage their costs
Optimize data pipelines to handle growing data volumes
Collaborate on designs for data pipelines and data tooling that meet performance and data quality standards
Participate in business analysis and data discovery to gather data requirements
Basic Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience
2+ years of experience in distributed systems, data engineering, software engineering or similar fields
Solid coding skills in a language such as Scala, Java or Python
Experience writing SQL queries
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Airflow or another workflow orchestration framework
Experience with data visualization or BI tools
Exposure to data modeling methodologies such as Kimball and Inman
Exposure to Big Data technologies

Description:
"Working in a matrix environment by partnering with service operations, OmniChannel and workflow leaders to build out a data consumption model to influence NPS, Call Obviation and reduction in Turn Around Time for our constituents
Establish and organize Nexidia data along with incorporation of other contact data sources in a canonical model allowing us to provide pro-active insights to current and potential future issues to our service operations teams and Executive Leadership

Identify and participate in the resolution of data integrity issues and organizational problems"

This position provides visibility, analytical, ad hoc and development capabilities leveraging data from Nexidia, Genesys, USP, ORS, Maestro, Portal, Asynchronous Chat and more.

Develop business context diagrams (e.g., business data flows, process flows) to analyze/confirm the definition of project requirements

3+ years of experience relational databases, database structures and design, systems design, data management, data warehouse.
3+ years designing reporting databases/data warehouses

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, Power Point and Visio
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience

Strong collaboration skills/experience

Description:
Optum is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, unit test and maintain ETL jobs to create or enhance Risk Adjustment data processes
Use SQL and ETL skills alongside your ability to quickly grasp operational data to help support short and long term operational/strategic business activities
Build and maintain billing item processes for new client or clinical program
Facilitate, manage and high-quality submission results for all clients until accepted by CMS or otherwise resolved
Monitor eligible visits to ensure that the maximum number of records are being submitted
Manage all errors within SLA timelines to ensure reprocessing of a submissions until acceptance
Instills an Agile framework within the team and across the matrix environment, fully utilizing KanBan and utilizing agile tools
Team player with aptitude to teach and learn new technologies
Proactive thinker, self-driven, great team player, and drive innovation
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or work experience equivalent
5+ years of expert level Microsoft SQL and SSIS development experience
4+ years of experience with relational databases, database structures and design, systems design, data management, data warehouse
4+ years of experience performing significant data analysis and data development
3+ years of experience in assessing and interpreting customer needs and requirements
2+ years of experience developing reports in Tableau, SSRS or equivalent reporting interface
2+ years of experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps and CI/CD
1+ years of experience in a customer facing role leading/managing projects, including requirements and documentation
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience of the different domains within health care
Experience working with Risk Adjustment Data
Experience in working on sensitive, complex, and urgent regulatory requests where data may be shared with internal and external clients
Expert level of understanding complex problems and troubleshooting knowledge
Solid soft skills (e.g., communication, interpersonal, collaborative, resilient)

Job Title: Software Engineer - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
Description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

The Data Engineer works closely with key business data and designs solutions by which information is loaded into and extracted from key IT and business systems. This position will leverage key development, database, reporting, analytic, and business intelligence skills across a diverse and multi-faceted application landscape.
Responsibilities:
Provide daily support to Corporate Legal’ s current suite of tools, and any technology needs that arise as result of a collection due to a legal matter
Due to the fluid nature of Legal eDiscovery this new role will fill the current gap around investigating, maintaining and updating business processes (i.e., assisting with the recovery of a UHG owned asset like a cell phone for data collection)
Provide basic development and deployment of modernized legal tools from legacy tools
Provide enhancement support to data feeds and automation where possible to continually improve our legal tools
May be asked to help with other areas when extra support is needed
Basic Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience
2+ years of experience using SQL
2+ years of experience programming in Microsoft .NET (C++, C#, .NET Framework, and .NET Core)
Experience with Software Development Life Cycle including Agile and Scrum models Demonstrable knowledge of object-oriented design and development
Demonstrated solid problem solving, debugging and fact-finding skills
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years - Experience developing REST/SOAP Services with JSON/XML
Effective working ability in an agile and team environment

Description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

Functions may include database architecture, engineering, design, optimization, security, and administration; as well as data modeling, big data development, Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) development, storage engineering, data warehousing, data provisioning and other similar roles. Responsibilities may include Platform-as-a-Service and Cloud solution with a focus on data stores and associated eco systems. Duties may include management of design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance, ensuring strict data quality, and performing needs assessments. Analyzes current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging data storage and retrieval system capabilities. Manages relationships with software and hardware vendors to understand the potential architectural impact of different vendor strategies and data acquisition. May design schemas, write SQL or other data markup scripting and helps to support development of Analytics and Applications that build on top of data. Selects, develops and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Generally, work is self-directed and not prescribed. Works with less structured, more complex issues. Serves as a resource to others.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Design, coding, and implementing databases and SQL processes consistent with established specifications and business requirements to deliver business value
Develop T-SQL queries, stored procedures, functions and other data objects
Performing data analysis and quality checks on data to identify technical and business opportunities
Developing SSIS packages
Performing design improvements, query optimization, problem isolation and corrective action for SQL processes
Troubleshooting production support issues post release deployment
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in engineering, computer science or related field or equivalent experience
5+ years of experience as a SQL Developer
3+ years SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and development of SSIS packages, working knowledge of SSAS, SSRS
Experience in Troubleshooting queries and Performance Tuning
Experience working with large datasets
Solid skills in T-SQL development such as stored procedures and functions
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Snowflake cloud architecture
Experience with health care data
Demonstrated experience using best practices for code design and development
Team-player who can also work independently
Excellent verbal/written communication skills

Description:
Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)

Join Rally Health as a Senior or Principal Data Engineer where you will partner with product managers and data consumers to meet our internal analytics and client data needs. You will use our modern data platform - which uses infrastructure and tools like Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, Spark, Databricks, Airflow, Amazon S3, and Amazon Redshift. You will oversee the entire lifecycle of data pipeline development from data discovery and design to quality and maintenance. As part of the larger Data Engineering team, you will report to an Engineering Manager. We recognize that people come from a diverse set of backgrounds and skills and we welcome all to apply.
Responsibilities:
Oversee the end-to-end discovery, design, development, and QA of big data pipelines.
Architect and code solutions for large-scale ETL pipelines with data processing frameworks
Develop data solutions to promote applicable insights for population health management and positive recommendations for ways individuals can improve their health and manage their costs
Assess current processes, recommend, and implement approaches to handle increasing volumes of data
Communicate technical specifications to ensure that proper and optimized techniques, queries, data standards, and final outputs are understood and incorporated into data and analytics processes
Participate in business analysis activities to gather required reporting and dashboard requirements
Handle the product's or project's conception, translate requirements, design initial technical specifications and develop data solutions
Basic Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience
5+ years experience in ETL, Data Engineering, or Business Intelligence fields with concentration on data transformations
Experience working in object-oriented or functional languages like Python, Scala or Java
Experience with backend and distributed systems
Experience designing data models with Kimball, OLAP, and other EDW methodologies
Experience with Airflow or another workflow orchestration framework (ex. Oozie, Prefect, DAGster)
Understanding of several data extraction and transformation techniques with data sourced in S3, MongoDB, and Postgres
Advanced working knowledge of complex Spark jobs and SQL queries
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with data visualization or BI tools
Experience with Scala

You will oversee the entire lifecycle of data pipeline development from data discovery and design to quality and maintenance. As part of the larger Data Engineering team, you will report to an Engineering Manager. We recognize that people come from a diverse set of backgrounds and skills and we welcome all to apply.

If you are located within the state of AZ, CA, CO, DC, FL, IL, MD, MN, NC, NJ, NV, NY, OR, PA, TN, TX, VA, or WA, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Play an important role in the discovery, design, development, and validation of big data pipelines
Build scalable Spark pipelines for large-scale healthcare data
Build datasets and data products that support population health management and positive recommendations that allow individuals to improve their health and manage their costs
Optimize data pipelines to handle growing data volumes
Collaborate on designs for data pipelines and data tooling that meet performance and data quality standards
Help with team goals including the support of live 24/7 production systems
Participate in business analysis and data discovery to gather data requirements
Basic Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience and 5+ years or MS and 3+ years of experience in distributed systems, data engineering, software engineering or similar fields
Solid coding skills in a language such as Scala, Java or Python
Experience in Big Data technologies
Experience writing SQL queries
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Airflow or another workflow orchestration framework
Experience with data visualization or BI tools
Exposure to data modeling methodologies such as Kimball and Inman
Exposure to Big Data technologies

Description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Maintain, improve, clean, and manipulate data in the business’s operational and analytics databases
Design and deploy data platforms across multiple domains ensuring operability
Transform data for meaningful analyses
Improve data efficiency, reliability and quality
Create data enrichment
Build high performance
Ensure data integrity
Create and manage data stores at scale
Ensure data governance - security, quality, access and compliance
Basic Qualifications:
BS/BA or equivalent experience
10+ years of experience designing, coding and supporting distributed, data intensive systems at scale
Good understanding and exposure to health care data sets (Provider, Clinical, claims and Individual/Patient in particular)
Ability to profile different data sets received from different CDOs in term of individual fields, data types, etc. and coming up with IN-TRANSIT and AT-REST schema definitions
Work with Enterprise standard schema definition team and help expand the standard schema where necessary or build a custom schema for care data platform requirements
Perform data quality checks and automate the validation of mapping raw data to standard schema
Proficient in SQL queries and DB normalization & denormalization concepts and automate the process of validating AT-REST schemas for data fitment
Good exposure to data loading, data transformation, data governance and data lineage aspects of data engineering
Data Architecture Principles, Experience of Model comparison/assessment and recommendation
Preferred Qualifications:
Healthcare business experience: Provider network Management, Hospital EMR/Billing system exposure, Revenue Cycle Management understanding, Physician Practice Management, CMS guidelines/mandates to Independent Physicians or Hospitals, Payer-Provider relationship, HEDIS, Member/Patient Risk Management
Hands-on experience with Data warehousing cloud tools such as Snowflake
Hands-on experience working with Azure cloud including terraform
Basic understanding of Azure cloud, Data streaming platform like Kafka, REST APIs consumption, GitHub and Jenkins CI/CD
Ability to analyses different schemas in JSON and Avro specifications, including the creation of newer ones in similar structure
Data publishing and Consumption pattern
Translating business requirement into Data Lifecycle
Data Model Management - forward engineering/backward engineering
Master Data Management - Identity mastering, Merger and Split management
Hands-on Exposure of Data Warehouse, Data Marts, Data Lineage, Data Quality Checking, Data Transformation, Data Load processes
Exposure programming languages such as Java/Scala/Python/go

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Develop efficient and high performing ETL solutions
Design, develop, test and performance tune complex ETLs
Participate in design review sessions and peer ETL reviews
Assess and profile source and target data (data structure, quality, completeness, schema, nulls, etc.) and requested business use cases
Summarizes testing and validation results and is able to communicate and make recommendations/decisions on the best course of action to remediate
Resourceful at coming up with solutions using existing or available resources based on knowledge of the organization and level of execution effort
Participate in agile work environment, attending daily scrum meetings and completing sprint deliverables on time
Supports practices, policies and operating procedures and ensures alignment to departmental objectives and strategy
Teammate is able to make the complex seem less complex, is a consensus builder and brings people and teams together
Is able to calm tense situations by bringing clarity and organization to the forefront
Ensures each level of the organization has the information needed and the context needed to produce favorable results
Builds sound relationship with IT operational leaders to ensure connectivity to the business
Supports a work environment in which people are able to perform to the best of their abilities. Holds self-accountable for technical abilities, productive results and leadership attributes
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management or similar
5+ years of experience in designing and developing ETL solutions
3+ years of working knowledge in a Data Warehouse/BI environment
3+ years of experience using Microsoft TSQL, SSIS, and SSAS
Windows batch PowerShell scripting and/or UNIX shell scripting experience
Sound RDBMS experience; Oracle PL/SQL and SQL Server
Sound SQL skills including complex SQL constructs, DDL generation
Sound ETL skills using Informatica or Azure Data Factory
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Atlassian JIRA and Confluence
Experience in Microsoft Azure and snowflake
Excellent organizational, analytical, writing, problem solving and interpersonal skills

Description:
We’re creating opportunities in every corner of the health care marketplace to improve lives while we’re building careers. And that means continuous career growth opportunities for you. While we support you with the latest tools, advanced training, and the combined strength of high-caliber co-workers, you can continue following the path of your life’s best work. (sm)

Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration, and opportunity, and this is what you get. Leading-edge technology in an industry that’s improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn’t about another gadget; it’s about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There’s no room for error. Join us and start doing your life’s best work. (sm)

As Principal Data Engineer, you will play the lead technical developer role in leading the business/contractual requirements, data, and ETL/reporting design, development, implementation, operations/maintenance. This position will also support data/ETL architecture, assure data quality/integrity for analytics/business intelligence reports. You’ll have the opportunity to work in complex ETL/data development tasks and support a talented team of analysts, developers, testers, and admins. This position will report to the project manager or their designee to help our business and teams co-create innovative solutions for our customers.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Developing ETL solutions and supporting data strategy leveraging acquired subject matter expertise to identify/inform opportunities/risks.
Developing/leading complex dashboards, scorecards, reports, data analysis
Performing peer-reviews and providing expert technical support/guidance to the project team
Leading creating/maintaining database, ETL, reporting architecture/environment, processes/procedures, coding standards, and data management/security activities
Supporting/Standing up the enterprise data environment for disaster situations or annual disaster recovery drill
Supporting the project manager and leadership in project planning and executing activities, including presentations, risks/issues, and status reporting
Demonstrating deliverables to the team or the customers for approvals and gain buy-in to implement solutions or adapt to new products/services/programs
Working with the vendors, DBAs, data modelers, and application/system admins to support maintaining the Teradata and application server hardware and software (including patches, fixes, and upgrades) and leading industry level standards or best practices.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors or Advanced Degree in a related field such as Information Technology/Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Analytics, Business Technology
7+ years of ETL and enterprise data warehouse technical development
7+ years of experience gathering requirements, exploring data, SQL/DB development
7+ years of experience in reporting, analysis, and/or data management/governance
4+ years of Informatica PowerCenter
4+ years of experience leading a team as a technical lead or similar capacity
Demonstrated experience working with, and leading, high-performing remote teams and delivering to external customer
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) with strong communication skills
If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders
Preferred Qualifications:
MBA or advanced degree
Experience in Medicaid/Managed Care/health insurance industry
Experience with visualization tools (Power B.I., Tableau, SAS, etc.)
Experience using Snowflake
Experience in scripting language experience (Python, R, SAS, T-SQL, etc.)
Familiarity with A.I. and machine learning

Job Title: Sr. Data Engineer - Eden Prairie, MN
Description:

If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Full development cycle of a Data Warehouse, including requirements gathering, design, implementation and maintenance
Gather and analyze business requirements
Develop technical specifications and design documents
Architect and design Data Warehouse infrastructure and solutions
Develop Test Strategy, Test Plans, Test scenarios, and Test scripts. Create Test Strategy / Test Data Requirements.
Test Data Warehouses/Data Marts
Deploy and maintain Data Warehouses/Data Marts
Write SQL statements to profile and analyze data
Work concurrently on several projects, each with specific instructions that may differ from project to project
Ensure that quality processes are carried out through all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle
Design and implement efficient and effective functional design solutions
Work closely with the Business and Developers to ensure requirements are met
Understanding of all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle, and using Agile Methodology and Tools
Respond to customer inquiries and production issues
Document, discuss and resolve business, data and reporting issues within the team, across functional teams, and with business stakeholders
Partner with Business during User Acceptance Testing , assist business users in defining User Acceptance Testing, test cases and plans. Actively participate in user group meetings to review use cases and review Test Results prior to UAT start
Present written and verbal data analysis findings, to both the project team and business stakeholders
Monitor activities associated with responsible domains - job monitoring, issue identification, documentation, analysis and resolution
Continually look for ways to eliminate/reduce, streamline, and automate
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of Data Analysis experience
5+ years of relational database experience
5+ years of complex SQL script writing experience
5+ years of experience testing
3+ years of experience with Agile/Scrum project management methodology and Agile tools (e.g. Rally or Jira)
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance
Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years of Healthcare Data Analysis experience
5+ years of SQL or Teradata experience
3+ years of UNIX /Perl scripting experiences
3+ years of experience with ETL tool
3+ years working on large data warehouse/big data projects
Healthcare Industry experience
Experience in an onshore/offshore model environment
Experience with Teradata
Experience with Data stage ETL tool
Experience with Enterprise scheduling tools
CA Agile Rally
Operations/production support
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Description: Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. Job Title: Software Engineer - Technical Operations - Minneapolis, MN
Description:
Careers at Solutran, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. We create direct spending solutions driven by our extensive financial tech experience to help those we serve be healthier, happier and more productive. Our platform helps members manage their health plans, supplemental benefits and rewards all in one place. You’ll have the opportunity to make it easier for consumers to manage their own health by making healthier products more affordable and their purchases streamlined. If you are a driven individual that thrives in fast-paced environments, values diversity and wants meaningful work that impacts the lives of many, then this is the team for you. Being part of an organization that makes healthier living easier for others leads to your life's best work.(sm)

Solutran is a leading FinTech company committed to creating game-changing, customer-friendly solutions. We serve health-seeking populations by partnering with the nation’s largest health plans, government programs, such as WIC and SNAP, as well as with employers and retailers. We’ve established a reputation for delivering modern, advanced customer experiences through best-in-class solutions used by millions.

Solutran has grown over four times in size in the last couple of years. As a result, in January we became part of the Optum Financial family (a part of UnitedHealth Group). The Solutran team and our platform are now at the center of the most significant healthcare payments innovation in modern history. The journey is just beginning. We expect this growth to accelerate and invite you to grow with us!

There are a lot of opportunities out there, but we can’t imagine being in a more solid, future proof and challenging intersection than that of healthcare and payments. Two of the most exciting growth verticals. Not to mention our solutions bring help to those who need it most.

As we expand our customer solutions, we are seeking an experienced software engineer to help deliver insights and automated solutions to help our systems display world-class reliability. This specific position is for someone who loves to dig in and remove impediments in the deployment pipeline. You will also help triage and support our production systems as well as apply your programming skills to develop and create solutions which improve application monitoring and performance.

The Software Engineer - Technical Operations will work on a team dedicated to improving our application service levels while providing a rich feature set, high availability, and performance for both internal and external customers. This position is part of a team that is the first line of support for ensuring our systems are up and running at their best. Work will be done in an environment where applications may rely on a blended infrastructure of both on-premise and cloud deployments.

We want you to bring fresh ideas, demonstrate a unique and informed viewpoint, and enjoy collaborating with a cross-functional team that develops real-world solutions and positive experiences at every interaction.
Responsibilities:
Primary Responsibilities
Develop and maintain deployment pipeline
Help achieve the Service Level Objective for our applications and services
Create and build necessary tools or processes required to meet our SLOs
Documentation and diagrams, outlining systems capabilities, processes, and environments in a manner that others can understand
Work on team projects, as well as individually assigned projects
Off hours support as needed - i.e. deployments
Participate in an on-call rotation with other Solutran Technical Service staff
Primary Platforms
CI/CD Pipeline development
Build Tools - Jenkins/Octopus/LiquiBase
.Net Programming
Logging and Monitoring - Splunk/DataDog
Oracle & PL/SQL
Source Control - git/tfs/BitBucket
Azure Cloud Platform strategy and operationsHelp achieve the Service Level Objective for our applications and services
Create and build necessary tools or processes required to meet our SLOs
Documentation and diagrams, outlining systems capabilities, processes, and environments in a manner that others can understand
Work on team projects, as well as individually assigned projects
Off hours support as needed - i.e. deployments
Participate in an on-call rotation with other Solutran Technical Service staff
Basic Qualifications:
2 or 4-year BA or BS, or university program certificate in related field
3+ years of experience as a software engineer with increasing responsibility
Preferred Qualifications:
Administration of IIS Web Servers / SSL Certificates
Secure Programing knowledge - VeraCode
Ticketing and Alerting Tools - Jira/FreshService/PagerDuty
PowerShell/Python Scripting
Performance Testing
Oracle Cloud
Solid customer service skills
Accurate and effective written and verbal communication skills
Solid organizational skills

Description:
If you're the kind of thinker and leader who wants to bring your contribution to a new level every day, bring yourself over to Optum. You'll discover an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

OptumInsight provides software and information products, advisory consulting services and business process outsourcing to participants in the health care industry. Government agencies, hospitals, physicians, commercial health plans, life sciences companies and other organizations that comprise the health care system work with OptumInsight to reduce costs, meet compliance mandates, improve clinical performance and adapt to the changing health system landscape. Government officials count on Optum to improve the efficiency and quality of their healthcare and human services programs. Our breadth of experience gives us a unique perspective and an unmatched ability to transform the performance of programs and improve the outcomes of the people you serve. 

In our State Government Systems business unit, we support forty state Medicaid agencies with an array of effective complex population health services, advanced analytics, policy and program consulting, program integrity services, and to  end-to-end solutions for Medicaid and HHS programs. Our goal is to help states drive transformation change for the people in your state. Professionals at this position will have an opportunity to dive deep into existing technology driven systems, partner with various types of stakeholders and drive innovative solutions to positively impact the quality of life for Medicaid supported populations.
Responsibilities:
Lead and own delivery for the work of assigned development team while contributing as a hands-on software engineer
Analyze existing software components and create technical documentation
Work with vendors, business, and technical stakeholders to obtain knowledge of existing systems and processes
Create and maintain technical artifacts such as data model and technical design specifications
Perform all phases of software engineering including requirements analysis, application design, code development and testing
Design and implement product features in collaboration with business and IT stakeholders
Design and develop reusable components, frameworks and libraries
Deliver projects using an Agile/Scrum methodology to deliver high-quality software releases every 2 weeks through Sprints
Leverage agile tools such as Rally to track and manage work to planned priorities and roadmaps
Work with Product owners, business analysts, architects, developers and other stakeholders to groom & solution features
Plan development tasks and provide accurate and timely estimates for tasks
Ensure that all capabilities developed within team satisfies the business requirements as specified
Identify and implement innovative solutions to non-standard requests and problems
Review code and approve code merges, providing technical guidance & best practices
Document and share technical best practices including coding standards and developer guides for chosen tech stack
Leads projects, mentor, train other team members and facilitate onboarding and ongoing training
Help hire, develop, grow and retain great engineering talents
Help the teams improve efficiency, quality and speed of their development processes
Provide input to forecasting and planning activities
Ensuring that mature DevOps practices are adopted within the organization
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
10+ years of experience with Object Oriented Design and Development with progressive responsibilities
5+ years of hands-on experience with Java, JSP, Microservices and Design patterns
3+ years of experience with Oracle PL/SQL and ability to write and tune advanced SQL queries
2+ years of experience as a Lead or Senior Software engineer with dev lead responsibilities
2+ years of experience with Struts, EJBs and JBoss server
2+ years of experience writing unit or integration tests using Junit, etc.
2+ year of experience working with Agile Methodology as a Scrum Master
Experience with agile management tools such as Rally or JIRA
Experience in working in an onshore/offshore model and managing major programs/multiple projects
Aware of latest technology trends, engineering processes, practices, and software metrics
Working knowledge of Git, Jenkins and containerization
Solid understanding of engineering fundamentals: unit testing, code reviews, agile and DevOps
Preferred Qualifications:
Full stack development experience
Oracle certification
State Government project experience
Working knowledge of RESTFul APIs
Test Driven Development experience
Experience with Log indexing tools (e.g. ELK stack, Datadog, Splunk, Sumologic) 
Knowledge of Angular and/or React
UnitedHealth Group/UHC/Optum experience 
Well-honed communication skills, evidenced by successful senior level interactions and presentation experiences

Description:
Description - External

Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. OptumServe’s mission is to help federal agencies tackle some of the biggest challenges in health care by partnering with the Departments of Health and Human Services, Defense, Veterans Affairs and other organizations to modernize the U.S. health system and improve the health and well-being of citizens across the country. The OptumServe Technology Services’ business unit focuses on health information technology and how to further federal customers’ missions by continually looking for ways to increase efficiency and thereby, lower costs. 

OptumServe Technology Services is looking for a Lead Software Engineer to provide design and development support, as well as technical analysis and research as part of a broader strategy to grow technical competencies and support federal customer needs. The Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for developing and implementing cloud-based technologies including tools and services, as well as proofs of concept and other research and development needs. 

It is expected that the Lead Software Engineer will have the ability and willingness to quickly learn new tools, conduct necessary research on various tools and technologies, and make recommendations for which tools best meet federal customer use cases. In addition, the Lead Software Engineer will provide hands-on development support for developing various software and applications such as data processing programs, data ingestion and transfer scripting, automation programming, and so forth.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.
Responsibilities:
Assesses requirements, use cases and customer needs to make recommendations on technical tools and services as part of solutions and pilots 
Serves as a key resource in developing key applications and programs in support of broader strategy and customer needs 
Solves complex problems as they arise in vetting new technology and develops innovative solutions as applicable 
Focuses on quality of work and continuous improvement for developing code and setting up tools and applications in the cloud 
Provides clear explanations and recommendations to other on complex issues including working with vendors as applicable on debugging, troubleshooting or research 
Adheres to deadlines and delivers on tasks assigned ensuring transparency with challenges, and proactively identifies mitigations and solutions to ensure tasks are complete on-time 
Reviews work performance by others and provides recommendations for improvement 
Collaborates with organizational leadership to understand strategy and needs to ensure recommendations and results align with expectations 
Collects input from other team members as well as internal and external stakeholders to fold into implementation or develop new ideas for delivering results
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years software, data and/or related engineering experience 
Experience working in multiple cloud environments, especially AWS and familiarity with cloud-native tools and services 
Experience with Python 
Experience working with cloud - native big data platforms such as Snowflake data warehouse as a service
Experience with DevSecOps tools and building CI/CD pipelines 
Understanding of cutting - edge technologies
Preferred Qualifications:
Certification in cloud or related technology
Experience working with CMS projects and other federal customers especially in a cloud-hosted system 
Experience in multiple programming languages such as PySpark, Java, Scala
Experience working with cloud-native programming, analytics and modeling tools such as Databricks

Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

Begin your career at UnitedHealth Group and you’ll get an opportunity to do something extraordinary with your first job out of school: make a real difference. We have modest goals: Help millions of people live healthier lives. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Brilliant. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 5 company. You’ll find a world of career options fueled by your performance and limited only by imagination. Start here.

Here’s the idea. We built focused businesses, inside UnitedHealth Group, organized around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. Through our two business platforms, UnitedHealthcare and Optum, we work to improve the health care system and advance the health and well-being of individuals and communities so that they can enjoy better, fuller lives. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges. It’s a culture of optimism that’s not like any place you’ve ever worked. Many incredible ideas in one incredible company.

We have an exciting opportunity to join the team as an Associate Software Engineer. You will be placed in technical positions with frequent exposure to senior leaders, businesses and technologies. You will have the ability to make meaningful contributions to the company and help people live healthier lives.

This role includes but are not limited to analysis, design, coding, engineering, testing, debugging, standards, methods, tools analysis, documentation, research and development, maintenance, new development, operations and delivery. With every role in the company, each position has a requirement for building quality into every output. This also includes evaluating new tools, new techniques, strategies; Automation of common tasks; build of common utilities to drive organizational efficiency with a passion around technology and solutions and influence of thought and leadership on future capabilities and opportunities to apply technology in new and innovative ways.

Software engineering is the application of engineering to the design, development, implementation, testing and maintenance of software in a systematic method. The roles in this function will cover all primary development activity across all technology functions that ensure we deliver code with high quality for our applications, products and services and to understand customer needs and to develop product roadmaps.
Responsibilities:
Perform all phases of software development lifecycle including requirement analysis, design, development and testing (unit testing, automation, deployment, and support)
Provide support in critical production support issue resolution as needed in DevOps teams
Support the team for application availability, reliability and stability
Work with team to achieve timely resolution of all production issues meeting or exceeding Service Level Agreements
Establish, refine and integrate development and test environment tools and software as needed
Participate in an Agile / Scrum methodology to deliver high-quality software and Attend Agile ceremonies
Push for technology solutions that create a better work environment / experience for developers
Work with the dev team and product management to create next-gen features
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related discipline
Experience in development of Health Care Systems or Managed Care Systems
Proficient in .NET programming (C++, C#, ASP.NET), MVC, Entity Framework
Proficient at writing SQL queries, stored procedures, views, triggers, and indexes
Demonstrated understanding of object-oriented programming concepts
Knowledge of development for EDI / X12 based systems with experience with 834, 835, 837
Computer algorithms awareness
Software programming language familiarity
Preferred Qualifications:
Solid time management, communication, decision making, and presentation skills
Display a solid desire to achieve and attain high levels of both internal and external customer satisfaction
Excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities
Self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Go-getter with a positive attitude

Description:
Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)

Join the Acceleration team as a Full Stack Software Engineer where you will work on central libraries and engineering tools designed to boost everyone’s productivity and happiness!
Responsibilities:
Write high-quality, fault tolerant code; normally 70% Backend and 30% Front-end (though the exact ratio will depend on your interest!)
Build high-scale systems, libraries, frameworks and create test plans
Basic Qualifications:
2+ years experience with JS libraries and frameworks, such as Angular, React or other
2+ years experience in Scala, Java, or other compiled language.
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with web design
Experience using RESTful APIs and asynchronous JS
Experience in design and development
Interest in learning Scala
Testing experience with Scala or Java
Database and caching experience, SQL and NoSQL (Postgres, Elasticsearch, or MongoDB a plus)

Optum is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. As a Software Engineer you will be part of the team that is taking a large reimbursement application in Optum and transforming it to a modernized platform. If you ever wanted to be part of major application redesign, this is the position for you. From solution design, to development, performance tuning, acceptance test and implementation you will be and hands on agent of change.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Performing all phases of software engineering including requirements analysis, application design, and code development & testing
Designing and implementing product features in collaboration with business and IT stakeholders.
Design, develop and test reusable frameworks, libraries and Java components
Be innovative in solution design and development to meet the needs of the business
Expected to adapt in dynamic and collaborative work environment and make independent decision
Understand new product capabilities and decompose the implementation into specific functional changes for verification
Participate in Agile/Scrum methodology to deliver high-quality software releases
Collaborate with the scrum team to meet project timelines
Review code and provide feedback relative to best practices and improving performance
Perform comprehensive testing of product distributions prior to release
Troubleshoot production support issues post-deployment and come up with solutions as required
Basic Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in design, development and implementation of enterprise applications
2+ years of experience with core and advanced Java or Java scripts
2+ years of experience working with Spring Framework
2+ years working with design patterns, coding standards and performance improvements
Experience working within an Agile/Scrum Methodology
Understanding of CICD process and tools - Jenkins, Automation, GIT, Artifactory, XL Deploy, Fortify Scan, Sonar Cube
Preferred Qualifications: Healthcare industry experience

Description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

We are building a Self Service and Onboarding Tool to support the enterprise Master Data Management application that ingests over 70+ sources. This team will be responsible for streamlining and to move into production a reusable, user friendly and machine learning application that sits in AWS.

We are looking for energetic and problem-solving engineers that can fail quickly and build fast!
Responsibilities:
Design and develop software applications (both backend and front end) and application components in an agile environment
Design, build & deploy performant and scalable solutions by applying engineering concepts like algorithms, data structures and development best practices
Contribute to code review process
Ensure high quality solutions by design and build unit tests, integration test, load test and user acceptance tests
Build methods and tools to automate development activities
Software design experience using object-oriented patterns, SOLID, and similar development principles
Ability to take on a complex technical problem that is not well-defined, decompose into manageable tasks, provide proper estimates, and lead/coordinate other team members to collective deliver the end solution
Ability to prioritize tasks and work concurrently on multiple tasks
Our vision includes:
Centralized Config Store and Config Management UI
User Provisioning, Source Provisioning, Feature Flag management
Client-Side tooling for profiling data before the data is sent to Enterprise MDM
Tooling for profiling data, statistical analysis for new sources as well as on going analysis for existing sources
Modernizing the iMDM mappers (reducing the number of mapper applications as well as reduce the cognitive complexity of left of matching)
ML algorithm to detect bad data, bad mapping by the sources
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in technical field OR equivalent work experience
2+ years of professional work experience
1+ years of experience with server-side development language such as Java or equivalent
1+ years of experience with CI/CD development environment
Experience working with databases and SQL
Experience working with Cloud technologies like Azure, AWS and proficient in DevOps practices
Experience with enterprise technologies and principles, such as REST
Expertise in designing, deploying, and monitoring a highly scalable microservice based environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with Linux and big data technology
Experience working in healthcare domain
Experience with large product integrations and performance enhancements
Software design experience using architecture and design patterns
Experience designing and developing scalable data applications using modern frameworks like Spark and big data

Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses.
