Care solutions lets people find, price, schedule, prepare and pay for care, and rewards them for choosing the appropriate care. Our digital focus is changing the way consumers experience their healthcare.

As a Software Engineer focusing on the UI, you will build reusable UI components and scalable features that are lightweight and fast for the user. Working within a team comprised of diverse skills, building engaging user interfaces, your work will develop responsive web apps that look and work great across multiple devices. You will work within the Care Solution group and you will report to the Manager, Engineering.
Responsibilities:
Provide meaningful contribution to code reviews
Write reusable code, initiate refactoring
Understand performance/scale tradeoffs
Create common tools
Apply coding patterns and best practices
Produce and deploy secure code
Use modern JS libraries and frameworks like React and React Native
Proficient using RESTful APIs and asynchronous JS
Frequently test your code with modern JS testing frameworks and tools
Create accessible web applications (WCAG 2.0 or 508)
Basic Qualifications:
Familiarity with front-end frameworks
Good understanding of CSS, HTTP, cookies, caching, and HTML5 web storage
Preferred Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or the equivalent experience
Understand software designs made by others
Coding abilities with architecture patterns of medium sized applications

The Engagement team offers seamless navigation and guidance across Rally helping users connect with the services they need to maintain and improve their health and make the best decisions. It enables employers by supporting their entire population's benefits and programs. The solutions include on-boarding, dashboards and resources, emails, SMS and content, the Rally app, third-party programs, and campaigns. As a Principal Software Engineer, you will report to the Engineering Manager of the team.
Responsibilities:
Build scalable systems, libraries, and frameworks
Contribute to frontend code using React and Angular frameworks
Work with your team to create test plans and ensure quality
Help automate our certification process
Monitor production systems and provide on-call support

5+ years of real industry experience
Unit testing experience (prefer Scalatest/Mockito/ScalaCheck)
Experience integrating with third-party APIs, and the ability to understand them in multiple formats
Experience with version control
Commercial experience with distributed, high-performance systems
Experience with cloud-based services and hosting (AWS EC2)
Background in Java or another compiled language
Interest in learning Scala or exposure to other functional programming languages
Preferred Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or the equivalent experience
Exposure to Javascript/Typescript-based frameworks like Angular/ReactNative
Iinvolved with open source projects

Optum Virtual Care team is part of Optum’s Digital Health organization. Digital Health’s priority is to create a more sustainable health care system leading condition centric management digital solution to deliver improved clinical outcomes. Digital Health’s goal is to build a seamless, intelligent, and personalized virtual care for members to direct them to next best action based on the individual’s health needs, condition and preferences by building a comprehensive and digital virtual care platform.
Responsibilities:
Work with Product owners to groom the user stories
Work with architects to understand and contribute to the solution
Develop software components
Enable CI/CD pipeline for the software components, implement code coverage, unit tests, code scans
Work with testing team to develop test scenarios and facilitate testing
Fix production defects
Collaborate with Global teams
Mentor junior developers
Basic Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree or 7+ years of related and equivalent experience
5+ years of experience with Java
3+ years of experience with Type Script, Angular
3+ years of experience working with RDBMS
2+ years of experience with GraphQL APIs
2+ years of experience with Azure Cloud, Jenkins pipeline, Guthub
2+ years of experience leading a team in technical capacity
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance

Careers at Solutran, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. We create direct spending solutions driven by our extensive financial tech experience to help those we serve be healthier, happier and more productive. Our platform helps members manage their health plans, supplemental benefits and rewards all in one place. You’ll have the opportunity to make it easier for consumers to manage their own health by making healthier products more affordable and their purchases streamlined. If you are a driven individual that thrives in fast-paced environments, values diversity and wants meaningful work that impacts the lives of many, then this is the team for you. Being part of an organization that makes healthier living easier for others leads to your life's best work.(sm)

The Senior Web/Mobile Software Engineer will have a primary focus on architecting and building internal and external 3-Tier web and mobile applications using ASP.NET MVC (C#), Angular, Xamarin and web services. Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

Software engineering is the application of engineering to the design, development, implementation, testing and maintenance of software in a systematic method. The roles in this function will cover all primary development activity across all technology functions that ensure we deliver code with high quality for our applications, products and services and to understand customer needs and to develop product roadmaps.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with product owners, systems analysts and software engineers to deliver against an agile roadmap of analytics initiatives to support business stakeholders in a self-service environment leveraging both on-prem and MS Azure platforms
Design, develop, test and maintain data intensive applications including ETL, relational and non-relational data storage, APIs and big data application development
Follow and improve on processes for continuous delivery and DevOps within your team

Description:

Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Create new APIs, internal platforms, and tools for 1,000 engineers to use every day to get their code shipped

The sum of 5+ years of experience across at least two of the following disciplines:
Experience writing applications in a modern programming language (Python, Golang, Scala, Ruby, C#, Javascript, etc.)
Experience with a major cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.)
Experience working with Linux containers (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
Has driven substantial improvements to an engineering team’s development process or platform
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with building and supporting CI/CD platforms for a microservices ecosystem
Experience building cloud infrastructure with Terraform, Ansible, CDK, or Pulumi
Experience with Kubernetes frameworks such as Helm, Flux, Argo CD

Description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Enterprise System Operating Controls (ESOC) is a software development team and center of excellence that identifies control improvement opportunities, builds, and operates controls. We’ve helped over 150 critical applications in Optum and UHC improve their controls, stabilize their data feeds, and prevent High Impact Quality Incidents.

We’re currently seeking a detail-oriented and self-motivated Quality Engineer to join ESOC. You’ll work with teammates around the globe to ensure our controls, and the tools that create them, are working properly.
Responsibilities:
Participate in agile teams to ensure high-quality software deliveries
Plan, prepare, and execute test cases manually and with automated testing tools
Identify and manage defects to resolution
Coordinate System, Integration, User-Acceptance, Parallel, Regression, or other types of testing in various environments when needed
Basic Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree or 5 years of related and equivalent experience
3+ years or more work experience working as a quality assurance analyst or engineer
Experience performing most - if not all the following:
Reviewing high-level specifications documents
Creating high-level strategies, plans, and schedules for sufficient test preparation and execution to ensure quality
Writing Test Cases
Reviewing Test Cases with the Designers and Developers, and making adjustments as needed
Creating Test Data
Adjusting the software and environment configuration information
Executing the software
Evaluating test results
Writing up Defects, and managing them through fixing, re-testing, and closure
Coordinating UAT and other testing phases
Providing status updates regularly at Daily Stand-Ups, and by updating required data in Rally User Stories, Test Cases, etc.
Preferred Qualifications:
Awareness of .NET applications running on Azure or Windows Virtual Machines
Good communication skills with PMs, Designers, and Developers who may be onshore or offshore
Ability to work independently, solve problems, and clarify unclear information
Knowledge of and experience using Automated Testing tools (e.g., Selenium) and writing automated tests in C# or Java
Knowledge of system integration technologies, including: FTP, ETL tools, KAFKA streaming, database replication tools, MQ, XML
Knowledge of application design concepts, including: APIs, Microservices, Object-oriented
Knowledge of and experience using Microsoft’s PowerBI reporting tool
Knowledge of and experience using Mainframe technologies

The Release Train Engineer will be responsible for leading the agile transformation and for the successful execution of one or more value streams (Release Trains) to support the delivery of strategic technology products. The RTE is a hybrid role that properly balances agile leadership and program management to help software development teams build and deliver solutions more efficiently.

This position requires individuals who have previously been successful Scrum Masters and/or Project Managers on highly distributed teams, have led Agile/Scrum adoption in the past, and have experience in software delivery as well as those who can drive and influence change and effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. Applicants should have experience leading teams and people from a human resources and career development perspective as this position has potential for direct reports.

Job Title: Senior/Principal User Interface (UI) Software Engineer (Navigation) - Telecommute
Description:
Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)

Join the Navigation team as a Senior or Principal User Interface (UI) Software Engineer. The team is responsible for developing, maintaining, enhancing and setting a high quality bar for web and mobile apps which assists end users in navigating their healthcare benefit coverage, claims, finding doctors/facilities, price comparisons and other features. You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Responsibilities:
Build extensible and reusable UI components and scalable features that are lightweight and fast for the user
Breathe life into static mocks with CSS animations, transitions and visual effects
Develop responsive web apps that look and work great across multiple devices
Be involved in the software lifecycle, from requirements gathering to development, testing and releasing code
Partner with product management and engineering leadership to bring creative technology and solutions to solve healthcare problems
Accountable for Product quality along with the team. Support the application and keep the quality bar elevated
Basic Qualifications:
3+ years of Experience with web or mobile development with relation to the User interface, experience and design
3+ years of web or mobile development with understanding of client and server topology and communication
2+ years of experience with React and/or React Native
Product related development experience within design and UX development
Preferred Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience
5+ years of real world industry experience
5+ years of experience with modern JS libraries and frameworks like Angular, React and React Native
Experience using RESTful APIs and asynchronous JS
Experience with CSS, web browsers, HTTP, cookies, caching, and HTML5 web storage
Experience creating accessible web applications (WCAG 2.0 or 508)
Experience with TypeScript is a plus
Experience migrating from Angular to React, a plus.
Experience in the Healthcare industry is a bonus
Familiar with authorization frameworks like oAuth 2.0, SAML or OpenID Connect is a bonus
Comfortable with Git

Description:
Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Help with team goals including the support of live 24/7 production systems
Participate in business analysis and data discovery to gather data requirements

BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience and 5+ years or MS and 3+ years of experience in distributed systems, data engineering, software engineering or similar fields
Strong coding skills in a language such as Scala, Java or Python
Experience in Big Data technologies
Experience writing SQL queries
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Airflow or another workflow orchestration framework is a plus
Experience with data visualization or BI tools is a plus
Exposure to data modeling methodologies such as Kimball and Inman is a plus

Software engineering is the application of engineering to the design, development, implementation, testing and maintenance of software in a systematic method. The roles in this function will cover all primary development activity across all technology functions that ensure we deliver code with high quality for our applications, products and services and to understand customer needs and to develop product roadmaps.

These roles include, but are not limited to analysis, design, coding, engineering, testing, debugging, standards, methods, tools analysis, documentation, research and development, maintenance, new development, operations and delivery. With every role in the company, each position has a requirement for building quality into every output. Demonstrated experience leading projects focused on innovations and development of Data products and/or solutions

Deep analytical thinking and the desire to bring data-driven insights to every discussion
Experience with the payer landscape data methods, including data collection, data standardization, data storage/security, and data processing
Published work in data engineering or information design, data architecture and Data Modeler experience

Description:
Description - External

If you're the kind of thinker and leader who wants to bring your contribution to a new level every day, bring yourself over to Optum. You'll discover an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

OptumInsight provides software and information products, advisory consulting services and business process outsourcing to participants in the health care industry. Government agencies, hospitals, physicians, commercial health plans, life sciences companies and other organizations that comprise the health care system work with OptumInsight to reduce costs, meet compliance mandates, improve clinical performance and adapt to the changing health system landscape. Government officials count on Optum to improve the efficiency and quality of their healthcare and human services programs. Our breadth of experience gives us a unique perspective and an unmatched ability to transform the performance of programs and improve the outcomes of the people you serve. 

In our State Government Systems business unit, we support forty state Medicaid agencies with an array of effective complex population health services, advanced analytics, policy and program consulting, program integrity services, and to  end-to-end solutions for Medicaid and HHS programs. Our goal is to help states drive transformation change for the people in your state. Professionals at this position will have an opportunity to dive deep into existing technology driven systems, partner with various types of stakeholders and drive innovative solutions to positively impact the quality of life for Medicaid supported populations.
Responsibilities:

Perform all phases of software engineering including requirements analysis, application design, code development and testing

Review code and approve code merges, providing technical guidance & best practices
Document and share technical best practices including coding standards and developer guides for chosen tech stack
Leads projects, mentor, train other team members and facilitate onboarding and ongoing training
Help hire, develop, grow and retain great engineering talents
Help the teams improve efficiency, quality and speed of their development processes
Provide input to forecasting and planning activities
Ensuring that mature DevOps practices are adopted within the organization

3+ years of experience with Oracle PL/SQL and ability to write and tune advanced SQL queries
